item.title: Fighter
item.description:
Men-At-Arms clad in steel that use various fighting styles to achieve the same goal: destroy as many enemies as possible using overwhelming martial prowess.

1 - Techniques
You gain 1 Technique point at level 1, then another point every 2 levels after. These technique points can be used on any martial tree.
You gain full progression in Warfare.
1 - Superior Attack
Once per turn, on any turn where you're capable of taking the Attack Action, you can make an Attack as a Free Action.
1 - Armor Training
Armors/shields require 2 less strength to use. You ignore stealth penalties from heavier armors.
1 - Endure
Standard Action, At-Will. Stand up and Resist all incoming damage for one round.
1 - Fury
Immediate Action, Recharge. Move 5ft and Resist physical damage for one round.
2 - Bravery
+4 to Saves vs Fear effects.
2 - Baby Slayer
When an enemy is a minion, you can tell just by looking at them. Gain an additional Superior Attack that can only be used against minion enemies.
4 - Smash from the Air
Gain Combat Reflexes as a bonus feat. If you already have it, gain a bonus feat. You can use an Attack of Opportunity to swat a Ranged Attack out of the air. Roll a melee Attack roll. If your attack roll exceeds theirs, the attack is negated. You must decide to use this before the roll is made. You take a -4 penalty to ACC against opposing siege weapons.
6 - Attack Speed
Gain +1 AS with all Weapons.
8 - Weapon Spirit
Standard Action, Recharge. You can enchant weapons you hold with any quality from the Magic Weapons section. You can enchant 2 different weapons, and give them different enchantments. You can enchant new weapons, but the old ones lose their enchantments.
Weapons enchanted in this way cannot have more than 2 enchantments.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: HP
item.description:
Hitpoints (HP) are a representation of how much offense you can weather. If you run out of HP, you are Defeated. Your total HP is determined primarily by Class, but can also be augmented by abilities, Feats, and even Race.
When you take Damage, you reduce your current HP out of your normal maximum HP. Your current HP value can be negative.
Every character with a class starts with 30 HP, with an additional bonus from their class every level (Usually around +10).
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Natural Healing
item.description:
Naturally Healing requires eating Food. Food restores varying amounts of HP based on the food eaten. You must take a Short Rest or Long Rest to eat food. The amount recovered is based on the food.
With a Long Rest, a character restores all of their HP and all of their Limited abilities and spent Mana. You can only Long Rest once each day. You must have eaten at least once since the last time you Long Rested (or eat during the Long Rest), or else you will not recover HP.
A proper Long Rest requires being in a safe environment with the minimum necessary accommodations to not ache in one's sleep. Lacking any of these requirements results in only restoring half of one's missing HP, or less if the situation is worse, at the DM's discretion. If you are interrupted but spent at least 15 minutes resting, it counts as a Short Rest.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Hitpoints/Natural Healing.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Short Rest
item.description: Taking a Short Rest requires being in a place with no immediate threats or hazards for at least 15 minutes, where you can eat and stretch and wipe your brow to benefit from Natural Healing. During a Short Rest, you can Prepare Techniques.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Hitpoints/Short Rest.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Food
item.description:
Food is one of the most common and necessary consumable resources to survive difficult journeys and dangerous dungeons. It is the slower, more efficient alternative to potions, which may grant their benefits briefly or in smaller amounts at a moment's notice.
It is assumed all food items are portioned properly as a meal, and cooked to preserve. They never spoil as long as they are handled properly and are not damaged directly, such as by fire. Raw ingredients will spoil unless cooked.
Food is consumed during a Short Rest over 15 minutes, unless otherwise stated.
Food primarily restores HP, but may grant bonus effects until you eat again or Long Rest.
The value of a particular food increases with how much it heals/what it grants and how little it weighs.
The creation of food requires edible organic materials, time, and skill. See Cooking for more.
The following are some basic examples of food:
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Special Attack
item.description:
Special Attacks are qualities that a Weapon can have that temporarily grant you a Technique-like ability as long as you wield them. See Class and Weapon Abilities. You must use the weapon when performing the Special Attack. As per the Mana rules, you cannot sacrifice your own Mana to get another use of a Limited Innate Technique unless otherwise stated.
Special Attacks uses are also tied to the weapon - If you use the Special Attack, you cannot pass the weapon off to another creature to use it again, and the weapon has its own Recharge timer. This means you can't take the Recharge action and then pass it off to another creature to use their own Recharge.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Weapon Qualities
item.description: Weapon Qualities describe what a Weapon does beyond its classification, Damage, and AS.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Bestial
item.description:
Bestial Techniques are collections of abilities that are intended to be used with Natural Weapons. Most are restricted to certain types of attacks, such as claws or tail sweeps.
Beasts and Natural Weapon-wielding creatures from the Bestiary will often have access to these as Innate Techniques.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Hyper Body
item.description:
Fighter Innate Technique
Standard Action, Limited
Buff
and Passive

You get a +4 bonus to Fortitude. Your HP increases by 6+4/LV.
As a Standard Action, grant 3+CHA allies an additional 4/LV HP. This is based on their level.
This bonus ends when they Long Rest, or you are Defeated.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Endure
item.description:
Innate Technique
Standard Action, At-Will

Stand Up without Provoking and Resist all incoming damage for one round.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

Innate Technique
Immediate Action, Recharge

Move 5ft and Resist physical damage for one round.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dark Sight
item.description:
Rogue Innate Technique
Immediate Action, Recharge

Gain the ability to use Stealth anywhere and Hide on the same action, as well as cause all Accuracy checks against you to fail. Lasts five turns, or until you Attack, cast a Spell, or otherwise take an offensive action. Creatures that are not using Detect do not get additional checks to spot you.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Haste
item.description:
Rogue Innate Technique
Standard Action, At-Will
Passive

Grant a touched ally +10 Speed and Jump for 10 minutes. Up to 3+CHA allies can benefit at the same time.
You gain this benefit passively.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Cleave
item.description:
Weapon Innate Technique
Action-Attack, Recharge
Compatible with these Weapon Groups:
Axe
Blade
Bludgeon
Polearm
Weapon must deal Slash or Crush Damage.

Make a melee Attack against the target with your weapon, and one additional attack against another target adjacent to it. This extra attack does not need to be in your reach.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Class and Weapon Abilities
item.description:
Class and Weapon abilities are not true Techniques, as they lack tiers (and thus do not scale with Upcast), and cannot be learned with Technique Points. They are very similar in function, however.
They are almost always Innate Techniques gained through your Class, Feats, Magic Items, and wielding Weapons that have them.
Special Attacks also fall into this category.
They are written separately for cataloguing and reference purposes.
Weapon abilities often list compatibility, but these compatibilities are not immutable. Particularly powerful weapons may have seemingly incompatible abilities, to represent their unique position.
item.guid: Techniques/Class and Weapon Abilities/Class and Weapon Abilities.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Astrology
item.description:
Tier 1 Lunar Spell
10 Minute Cast Time, At-Will
M - Scroll or Parchment
Divination

When the spell is complete, you convert a scroll or parchment into a Horoscope. The target can read the Horoscope to gain insight into some of the strengths and failings they may have within the next 24 hours. As long as they have the horoscope on their person, they may add 2 to their Roll on a skill check. This cannot be used with Take 10 or Take 30. After they use this benefit, the horoscope disappears.
A creature that cannot read cannot benefit from their Horoscope. A creature may only benefit from Astrology once per day.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Enchant Sapphire
item.description:
Tier 1 Lunar Spell
1 Hour Cast Time, At-Will
M - Sapphire Jewelry or a Sapphire, worth at least 500g
Divination, Transmutation

You cast a spell on a Sapphire jewel or jewelry, turning it into a consumable magic item. The effects vary based on where the item goes on the body. Jewelry pieces take up Equipment Slots.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Natural Geomancy
item.description:
Tier 1 Lunar Spell
10 Minute Cast Time, At-Will
Divination

For the duration of this spell, you get a mental ping whenever anything happens to the targeted plant or plot of terrain. You are informed what kind of interaction happened, such as whether it was trampled, touched, clipped, watered, etc. no matter how insignificant the interaction. You're also aware of the environmental conditions they are experiencing, such as approximate temperature, humidity, and even noise level.
For plants, you gain a +2 bonus to Nature checks to determine their health and needs, and can identify such mentally and remotely.
This spell does not grant visual stimuli.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Provider's Station
item.description:
Tier 1 Lunar Spell
10 Minute Cast Time, Limited
Conjuration

You must have access to the night sky to cast this spell.
When the spell is complete, you create an object or small facility that meets the bare minimum requirements for a particular task, trade, or skill, such as a furnace for heating pottery or a lockpick. This item will break if used for anything other than its intended purpose, and disappears after the spell's duration or if exposed to sunlight.
You must create facilities that can fit within a 10ft cube. This spell does not provide fuel to run facilities. It may create objects with multiple parts, such as a series of vials and tubes for use in alchemy, but these cannot be separated from the facility without disappearing.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Star Sight
item.description:
Tier 1 Lunar Spell
Standard Action, At-Will
Divination

You gain a completely unobstructed view of the sky as though it was a clear night. You ignore obtrusive environmental conditions, being indoors and underground, light pollution, and anything similar.
You get a +2 bonus to Navigate.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Lunar Dream
item.description:
Tier 2 Lunar Spell
Standard Action, Limited
Transmutation

This spell must be cast in the presence of moonlight.
You fall asleep, your body lifted into the air on a cloud of stardust.
Every minute, you regain 1 HP. After 30 minutes, you are restored to full HP. You also gain a new save vs any Poison and non-Curse spell effects. This counts as a Short Rest, but you cannot eat to gain the benefits of Food.
You are otherwise asleep as normal, and anything that would normally wake you up still can. This ends the spell early, denying its full effect.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Unseen Blade
item.description:
Tier 2 Lunar Spell
Swift Action, At-Will
Subtle
Illusion

When making any Attack while the target is in the presence of moonlight, you can turn your weapon or projectile partially invisible to Feint the target right before the attack is made.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Unseen Form
item.description:
Tier 2 Lunar Spell
Swift Action, Recharge
Subtle, Buff
Illusion

While in the presence of moonlight, you become partially invisible, granting you Total Concealment from creatures beyond 30 feet, and Partial Concealment from any creatures closer.
Taking any actions besides simple interactions or movement reduces the effect to Partial Concealment.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Sacrificial Heal
item.description:
Tier 3 Lunar Spell
Standard Action, At-Will
Healing
Conjuration

Sacrifice any amount of your own HP. The target heals for the same amount.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Vengeance
item.description:
Tier 3 Lunar Spell
Immediate Action, Recharge
Buff
Evocation

You may cast this spell in response to an Attack, AoE, or Targeted effect being declared on you, but before its result is known. You may also cast it at any point on your turn. Remind your DM to announce attacks before making them to make casting this spell less awkward.
You reflect 75% of the next instance of damage you take as Magic Damage back at the attacker.
This spell is particularly easy to identify due to its distinct visual effect of a skull appearing over your head, making the DC to Identify Spell 10 points lower.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Energy Transfer
item.description:
Tier 4 Lunar Spell
Standard Action, Limited
Conjuration

You must have your Recharge action available to use this Spell.
You put your Recharge on cooldown to grant another creature the benefits of Recharge.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Vengeance Other
item.description:
Tier 4 Lunar Spell
Standard Action, Limited
Buff
Evocation

Functions as Vengeance, but on a creature other than yourself. It cannot be cast reactively.
You reflect 75% of the next instance of damage you take as Magic Damage back at the attacker.
This spell is particularly easy to identify due to its distinct visual effect of a skull appearing over your head, making the DC to Identify Spell 10 points lower.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Magic Imbue
item.description:
Tier 5 Lunar Spell
Standard Action, Limited
Conjuration

You instantly restore a Limited ability of any kind to the target creature or item.
You can only cast this on a given creature or item once per day.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Lunar
item.description:
Surrounding the magic of the moon are many Lunar Realms, ruled over by a single Lunar Kingdom. The magic of the realms themselves bestowed the royalty of the ruling class, with the Queen and King at the top being given unique wisdom and strength with which to lead their people.
The secrets to their magic were closely guarded by the royal family until the last King was murdered in a foreign adversary's coup attempt, and the princess at the time mysteriously disappeared for months. When she returned to take the throne back, she made the secrets of the Moon Queen's Wisdom public knowledge, but the secrets to the Moon King's Strength was forever lost when the Moon Princess died without providing the Lunar Realms a new heir.
These spells are based upon the Moon Queen's Wisdom. They focus on abilities passed down from the stars themselves that grant foresight, prosperity, retribution, and access to the ebb and flow of magic from heavenly bodies. Many offensive Lunar spells have delayed or indirect effects.
Some Lunar spells require access to the night sky.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Marine
item.description: Marine Sorceries are sorceries focusing on ocean travel and water-based magics. It is a generalist spell list with diverse spells of somewhat lesser impact than equivalent groups.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Solar Flash
item.description:
Tier 2 Prismancy Spell
Standard Action, Recharge
Fire, Light
Evocation

All sighted creatures (minus self) must make a Reflex Save or take CL Fire Damage and be Blinded for one round.
Resisting the damage does not negate the Blinded effect.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Bless
item.description:
Tier 1 Vitalism Spell
Action-Attack, Recharge
Holy, Concentration, Buff
Conjuration

The target gets +2 ACC, and its physical Attacks gain Holy Damage.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Caloric Healing
item.description:
Tier 1 Vitalism Spell
Standard Action, Recharge
Healing, Caloric
Conjuration

Burn a Food item in hand to heal the target for half of what the Food normally heals. This doesn't grant any other bonuses that come with the sacrificed item.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Invigorate
item.description:
Tier 1 Vitalism Spell
Action-Attack, Recharge
Conjuration

The target gains a new save against one ongoing effect that is not permanent.
They also stand up from Knocked Down, and their weapons gain +1 AS on their next turn.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Vitalism
item.description: Vitalism spells are a supporting caster's best toolkit. They are tailored towards protecting the sanctity of life, and reaching and increasing the strength of allies. These spells are typically Holy-aligned, and any offensive abilities are typically tailored towards disrupting Fiends and Undead.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Spell Components
item.description: Spells have components that must be used to cast them. This almost always includes Staff (S) and Verbal (V) Components, and sometimes include Material (M) Components. These rules do not apply to Innate Casting.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Nebula
item.description:
Tier 2 Lunar Spell
Action-Attack, Recharge
Magic, Light
Evocation

Conjure a cloud of stardust that illuminates in a 20 ft radius beyond its borders. It obscures vision through it beyond 5 feet, granting Partial Concealment. Anything beyond 5 feet grants Total Concealment. At the end of the spell's duration, it erupts, dealing 2 SP+CL Magic Damage to all creatures in the area.
Upcast 1 - +1 SP Damage
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Innate Technique
item.description:
Some Techniques can be granted outside of the standard progression, such as when gained from Race, Class, magic item, specialized training, or a boon granted by another creature. Not all Techniques gained in this way are innate - these are much more common on monsters.
Innate Techniques acquired by players do not take up Mana slots and are always prepared. Monsters usually have their natural abilities represented by Innate Techniques, and as such are usually made with an amount equal to their Mana.
Innate Techniques grant creatures the ability to use Techniques without the usual requirements. Spells do not require the Staff component that other casting typically requires. If a spell has a material or focus component, that is also ignored with innate casting. Concentration spells can still be ended with a Disarm Combat Maneuver. Only one Concentration effect can be upkept in this way.
Unless otherwise specified, you cannot re-prepare limited innate techniques to regain their use.
If a creature's innate constant spell is deactivated, it can reactivate it as a Swift Action.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Preparing Techniques
item.description:
When you have technique points invested in a specific style, you can prepare any of the techniques of the tier you have unlocked. Mana slots determine how many techniques you can have prepared or "memorized" at any given time and thus what you can use at a given moment.
All techniques are assumed to take 1 mana slot unless stated otherwise.
Abilities from items, classes, etc. do not take mana slots unless stated otherwise - see Innate Technique.

item.title: Index
item.description:
Malon's Marvelous Misadventures is a TTRPG where the players take on the roles of capable adventurers in a fantasy world, facing off against the odds themselves as they plow through hordes and chow down on the rewards! It's centered on systems that maximize the ease of content creation and compatibility with what exists in other tactical TTRPGs.
The content provided will be enough to run relatively lighthearted fantasy games, and serves as a basis to create more and adapt it to your needs. The game mechanics are a blend of real-world intuition and game-y themes, setting a stage with a healthy amount of suspension of disbelief to allow more creative solutions to problems without worrying too much about adherence to realism.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Elemental
item.description:
Elementals often blur the line between a "being" and a hazard or force of nature. They are manifestations of elemental magics, be they nearly-invisible dust devils pushing and pulling their victims, or vaguely humanoid plasma leaving a trail of fire in their wake.
As entirely magical creatures, their behavior tends to be unpredictable, and their presence is often unexpected. They may form spontaneously when there is an area of uncontained concentrated mana, such as when a ritual fails, or when a specific element is present in abundance, such as in a volcano. Spontaneous elementals often use their violent magics to spread the presence of their element further from the source, or defend its element from being extinguished.
Many elementals will disappear on their own when there is nothing for them to act on.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Skeleton, Garden
item.description:
Garden Skeleton, LV 0 Undead

Attacks
Garden Skeletons are found with a variety of basic or improvised weaponry - more often improvised melee weapons.

Abilities


Other Traits
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Grab
item.description:
Requires a free hand or prehensile appendage. As long as the Grab persists, you and your foe gain the Entangled condition, the grabber is considered Grabbing, and the target is considered Grabbed. Each round you can spend another Action-Attack to maintain the Grab and deal damage as per a melee Attack, requiring no Roll.
If you are moved out of reach from the target, your opponent succeeds at a Grab on you, or you are otherwise unable to maintain your grip, the target is freed and the conditions end. Opponents that Grab you in return can continue the Grab as if they are Grabbing.
Special: Multiple creatures can Grab one creature. The Entangled conditions stack.
Special: Creatures ignore the attack penalty from partial and total concealment against creatures they are engaged in a Grab with.
See alternate win condition>restraint/capture for more options on locking someone down for good.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Grab.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Glowing
item.description:
Creature emits Bright Light with a 5 Ft Radius, causing it to suffer -20 Stealth and -2 AC.
The AC penalty does not stack with Ablaze.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Glowing.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Unassailable
item.description: Creature ignores penalties that result from Circumstance or Status.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Unassailable.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Light
item.description:
Effect either creates light, or has special interactions when in it.
If unspecified, it creates Bright Light in its area of effect for one round, or on the spaces where something was targeted.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Subtle
item.description:
The effect has a chance for nobody to notice it. If the target creature fails its save, then the effect goes unnoticed. The DC to Identify Spell with the subtle tag increases by 5.
If someone is watching you and suspects you are using a subtle spell in their presence, they can use Detect to get a Perception check at -10 against the Identify Spell DC of the effect.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Spell
item.description:
By observing a Spell as it is being cast, you can Instantly use Arcana to identify which Spell it is. The DC is 5 per level of the Technique (not including Upcast.)
This is useful for determining whether you want to take action in response, or it has no immediate effect - though many Spells do not need to be identified if you already know the spell.
You may use Astronomy to identify Lunar spells, and Nature to identify Gaia spells.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dispel
item.description:
Tier 2 Academy Spell
Action-Attack, Recharge
Abnegation

This spell can be used in two ways.
Dispel - You Roll opposed CL to immediately end a magical effect. You must be aware of which effect you are specifically trying to dispel, as blind attempts at dispelling will fail. If you try dispelling magic you know is there but aren't aware of the properties, effects, or purpose of the spell, you take a -5 penalty.
Counter Spell - You Roll opposed CL to prevent a spell from being cast. This must be done as a Prepared Action in response to a spell being cast. If the spell the creature is casting has a higher CL than your Dispel, they get a +5 bonus.
You can use Dispel on supernatural features, labeled (Su). The creature's CL is treated as (LV+2). Passive supernatural effects or constant innate spells can be reactivated as a Swift Action.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Double Speak
item.description:
Tier 1 Enthrallment Spell
Instant Action, At-Will
Subtle
Illusion

You change the sounds of your speech before they reach the target creature, causing them to hear something different than what you said. For every sentence you speak, you can cause them to hear a different sentence.
This allows you to speak to two different people at the same time and tell them two different things.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Verboden Taal
item.description:
Tier 1 Enthrallment Spell
Standard Action, Limited
Buff
Divination

When you cast this spell, designate a word, phrase, or name. If a creature within 1 mile of you uses that word, phrase, or name to refer to you, you immediately learn that creature’s name, appearance, and location. This ends the spell.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Confide
item.description:
Tier 2 Enthrallment Spell
Instant Action, Limited
Psychic, Subtle
Divination

Whenever you share information with a creature that it promises not to share (or a similar conditional offer of information and promised subtlety), you may cast this spell on them, which delays its effect until they break their promise.
If the target breaks their secrecy, the spell activates, and you can see through their eyes and senses for up to 10 minutes, after which the spell ends for good.
At any point during those 10 minutes, you may end the spell prematurely to inflict 40 Psychic Damage on the target. This damage cannot kill the creature outright, but if it is Defeated by this damage, it gains the Placeholder Affliction.
This spell does not stack. If multiple creatures use Confide on the same creature, it may only be affected by the damage once per day.
Upcast 1 - +20 Damage.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dominate
item.description:
Tier 3 Enthrallment Spell
Action-Attack, Recharge
Mind-Affecting, Charm, Concentration
Illusion

You link your mind with a creature and enforce your will upon it. The creature must save or be Charmed for the duration of the spell, and you can telepathically give orders to the dominated creature. They must follow these orders unless they are very obviously self-harming. For all intents and purposes, this creature is considered your ally as long as they are dominated. If you know of the creature's abilities, you can command it to use them, otherwise they use their normal tactics in your aid.
At the end of each turn, the creature gets a new save against the effect.
The spell ends if any of your allies harm the target (including you).
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Order 66
item.description:
Tier 3 Enthrallment Spell
1 Minute Cast Time, Limited
Charm, Contingent, Language-Dependent
Illusion

You plant subconscious cues into a helpless or willing target. After completing the cast time, you cause the target to forget you casted this spell. At any point thereafter, you can trigger the true effects of this spell by speaking a passphrase in a manner where the target can clearly hear you as a Standard Action. For 1 minute, the creature aids you in combat, attacking your enemies as you direct them. Once this effect is triggered, the contingency ends.
The contingent aspect of this spell applies to the caster, not the target creature.
The spell leaves behind subtle cues, allowing those Trained in Insight to realize the creature is affected by this spell (Spell DC+4). Creatures only ever get 1 check to realize this enchantment is in place.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: The Hand that Feeds
item.description:
Tier 3 Enthrallment Spell
Action-Attack, Recharge
Mind-Affecting
Illusion

You bring forth all of the negative memories and feelings a companion has for its leader. The target Companion is Taunted by its leader for 1 round (Will negates).
This ability cleanses all other taunt effects currently affecting the companion creature if the spell is successful.
Upcast 2 - You can target an additional Companion.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Thrall
item.description:
Tier 5 Enthrallment Spell
Standard Action, Limited
Mind-Affecting, Charm, Companion
Illusion

Functions as Dominate, but is permanent. The affected creature becomes a Companion and does not get new saves on its own.
If a friend, ally, respected superior, family member, or similar person of significance uses Aid on the creature, it gets a new Will save at -5. If at least three creatures spend their turn doing this at once, there is no penalty. Certain types of people, such as people related to the controlled creature's destiny or true love, can give them +5 on their save.
Successful Dispel attempts grant a new save.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Brilliant Barrage
item.description:
Tier 1 Prismancy Spell
Attack AS 1, At-Will
Fire, Light
Evocation

Roll a Ranged Attack. On a hit, deal SP Fire Damage, and the target begins Glowing.
Upcast 1 - AS +1
Special: You must have unlocked the higher tiers of Prismancy to Upcast an equal amount.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Lady of Light
item.description:
Tier 1 Prismancy Spell
Passive
Fire, Light, Buff
Evocation

You shine with incredible light, clearly illuminating a radius of 60 with Bright Light, with a further 20 being Dim Light. Despite this, the details of your form are still clear, though you lack shadows. You also radiate heat to anything nearby, hot enough to be toasty, but not hot enough to cause damage or ignite anything. You are protected from cold ambient temperatures.
You get -20 Stealth against creatures that can see, unless you are in an area that is brighter than you.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Zonnestraal
item.description:
Tier 5 Prismancy Spell
Standard Action, Limited
Light, Fire, Concentration, Persistent
Evocation

You fire a beam of purifying light, dealing 7 SP+CL Fire Damage and Blinding everything it hits for one round (Reflex halves the damage and negates Blinded). This automatically destroys objects of solid or lesser toughness, and if it's enough to break them, it continues past them. This damage area is persistent, and creatures that enter it must save against the damage. If the line impacts the ground or something it cannot destroy, it gains a 10 Ft Radius around the impact site in addition to the line.
Fiends and Undead creatures that fail their saves are set Ablaze.
You may not move while concentrating on this spell, and you do not fall if you are in the air. If you are moved against your will, the spell ends.
At the start of your next two turns, the damage occurs again, and you may sweep the beam up to 60 degrees (one hex direction) to target a new line and everything between the two lines that gets caught in the sweep. The sweep area is not persistent, but the new line is.
Upcast 1 - +1 SP Fire Damage.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Prismancy
item.description:
Prismancy sorceries are spells that focus on heat and light to inflict maximum damage as quickly as possible. Each spell channels the power of intense light, unleashing explosive projectiles, blinding flashes, and radiant energy capable of turning the world into a prismatic inferno.
This spell list was developed by Tiara Torneau, an Evocation Archmage renowned for her mastery over flames and light. Using her inherited powers over light, this hobby magic turned into a field of study that brought fire magic to the next level, incorporating auroras and the power of the sun to devastating results. Her goal of ending fights with overwhelming power were shared with the pyromancers of the time, resulting in a modern list that will tickle any blaster-caster's fancy of annihilation and enormous, flashy explosions, while maintaining the utility necessary for an adventuring sort.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Blazing Palm
item.description:
Tier 1 Pyromancy Spell
Action-Attack, At-Will
Fire
Evocation

Roll a Ranged Attack. On a hit, deal SP Fire Damage, and the target is set Ablaze.
Upcast 1 - +1 SP Damage
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Flame Blade
item.description:
Tier 1 Pyromancy Spell
Action-Attack, Recharge
Fire, Martial
Evocation

Make a Melee Attack. It gains SP Fire Damage.
Upcast 1 - +1 SP Damage
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Flame Pillar
item.description:
Tier 1 Pyromancy Spell
Standard Action, Recharge
Fire, Concentration, Persistent
Evocation

The targeted space erupts, causing a pillar of flame to appear. Creatures in this area, and that pass through it, take 2 SP Fire Damage (Reflex halves). Creatures that end their turn in the pillar are set Ablaze.
Upcast 1 - +1 SP Damage.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Burning Hands
item.description:
Tier 2 Pyromancy Spell
Action-Attack, Recharge
Fire
Evocation

Deal 2 SP+CL Fire Damage to a cone in front of you, Reflex halves.
Upcast 1 - +SP Damage
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Detonate
item.description:
Tier 2 Prismancy Spell
Action-Attack, Recharge
Fire, Light
Evocation

An Ablaze target takes 2 SP Fire Damage, the DC to save against the condition is increased by 4, and the penalty to AC is increased to -4. Only Standard Actions grant a new save against being Ablaze. If an effect would normally automatically remove Ablaze, it instead only grants a save without the -4 penalty.
Upcast 1 - +1 SP Damage
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Flame Tempest
item.description:
Tier 2 Pyromancy Spell
Immediate Action, Recharge
Fire
Evocation

You spontaneously explode, dealing CL Fire Damage to everything and pushing all targets other than yourself 15 ft back (Reflex negates).
Upcast 1 - +5 Radius
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fire Blast
item.description:
Tier 3 Pyromancy Spell
Action-Attack, Limited
Fire
Evocation

Throw an enormous ball of fire that explodes forcefully, dealing 3 SP+CL Fire Damage and Knocking Down creatures struck (Reflex halves, and negates Knockdown).
You can target one specific creature with a Ranged Attack. If you land it, the creature's space is the center of the explosion, and it takes a -2 penalty to its save. If you miss, the fire falls directly down and then explodes when it first impacts a surface.
This also destroys flammable undergrowth, sends small objects flying, starts fires, disperses atmospheric conditions, and otherwise causes the effects one would expect from a fiery explosion.
Upcast 1 - +SP Damage, +10 Range, +5 Radius
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Ifrit Milicien
item.description:
Tier 4 Pyromancy Spell
Passive, Limited
Summoning, Companion
Conjuration

You conjure an Ifrit that will fight by your side.
If it dies or is otherwise dismissed, this Technique is expended and must be Prepared again to summon another.
Upcast 1 - Ifrit's level increases by 1, and it gains 10 HP.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Meteor Swarm
item.description:
Tier 5 Pyromancy Spell
Standard Action, Limited
Fire
Evocation

Launch four enormous meteors that engulf 40 Ft Radius areas in flames, dealing 5 SP+CL Fire Damage. Creatures engulfed in more than one explosion take an additional SP Damage and take a -1 penalty to their Save per additional Meteor.
Upcast 2 - Gain an additional Meteor
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Extraplanar
item.description: An Extraplanar creature is any creature that originates and lives in another plane of existence. It cannot be found in the universe unless it came through a portal from another dimension, or it was summoned.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Yokai
item.description: Yokai are a category of Fiends. Consistent, exceptionally evil acts from the most heinous and powerful individuals and organizations can cause the creation of legendary fiends that become forces of nature themselves. These events strip away the identities of those that propagated them and their victims, burning away their souls before their time is up, and leaving them with no desires except for the game itself.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Abomination
item.description:
Abominations are terrors born from the unknowable and the otherworldly. They cannot be reasoned with. They are utterly insurmountable nightmares that humanity has no hope of escaping.
From the darkest depths of space, the ocean and other mysterious realms, aberrations are often alien creatures uninterested in the conventions of traditional life. Others are strange mixes of the organic and inorganic in unfamiliar animalistic shapes.
Abominations are characterized by organized domination, horrific departures from traditional violence, hiveminds, and eerie motives.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Beast
item.description:
The Beast group contains a wide variety of mundane animals, ranging from nimble rodents and cunning predators to massive herbivores and resilient scavengers. Whether encountered in dense forests, treacherous mountains, or bustling urban areas, these beasts are simplistic and feral, reminding players of the wilderness's unpredictable nature and the survival instinct that drives all living things.
Beasts are mostly unintelligent one-trick ponies, and are quick to flee when their trick fails, or when their opponent proves more dangerous than their value in meat. Herbivorous beasts typically only fight in self-defense, and will flee unnecessary battles.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Celestial
item.description: Celestials are the creatures from higher planes, all which serve a specific purpose towards furthering the order of the universe. They range from Angels, divine messengers of holy gods that aid in the fights against chaos, to Inevitables, single-minded beings that enforce the laws of the universe and root out those that try to break them. Creatures in this group tend to respect and bargain with others in the same group, as they all have similar goals. An Angel may bargain with Death to reincarnate a necessary ally, or consult with an Inevitable to learn of how to stop a reality-warping ritual. All Celestials are Extraplanar.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Construct
item.description:
Constructs encompass all constructed beings, ranging from ancient golems animated by arcane forces to intricate automatons powered by sophisticated machinery. Most constructs are created by an intelligent mind, but some are formed from natural primal magic. Their purpose can vary greatly, most serving as simple guards or weapons, while technological or intelligent constructs may be made to write, convey information, and research.
Most constructs tend to have a "master" when made, or a method of establishing control over it. Their minds tend to work like programs, working entirely within the scope of their directives, or with a single-minded purpose - however, autonomous, free-thinking constructs are not unheard of.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fey
item.description:
Fey are whimsical nature-bound creatures that live on the border between fantasy and reality. Many appear dreamlike or nightmarish, or like the results of hallucinations, often with nonsensical anatomy and far too many colors.
Fey tend to serve mundane, but otherwise natural purposes in the world, such as the spread or cleansing of disease. Some represent concepts or ideas that are otherwise neutral, such as fey of happiness, sadness, marriage, censorship, and flavor.
Fey cultures often appear whimsical and mischievous, contrasting sharply with the more straightforward attitudes and behaviors of humanoid cultures.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fiend
item.description:
Fiends are chaos incarnate. They seek to destroy the natural order in any way they can, usually by killing, burning, and corrupting everything that exists until there is nothing but suffering and ruination left.
Many come from lower planes, such as devils and demons that form from the recycled souls of deceased mortals. These fiends are made from pure malice, making them almost impossible to trust or convert. There is no humanity left in them, all that remains being used only to trick and outsmart mortals. They often reflect the worst of the humanoid races, as traits that are normally considered sinful become manifest in their abilities. Luckily for the material plane, most extraplanar fiends need assistance or coordination to escape The Abyss from which the come.
Despite this never-ending blasphemous source, many of the most powerful Fiends often come from the material plane itself, known as Yokai.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Humanoid
item.description: Humanoids represent the humanoid races, as well as anything sufficiently humanoid to use the same weapons and armor that a human does. They tend towards using tools, techniques, and teamwork to defeat their enemies, rather than natural attacks or abilities.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Monster
item.description: Monsters are a magical and significantly more intelligent step up from otherwise mundane creature types. They are rare mythical creatures, larger than life and saturated with power, ranging from the inescapable Minotaur to the mighty Dragon. They almost always come with incredible magic powers, such as deadly breath weapons, teleportation, and even illusions.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Ooze
item.description: Oozemorphs are amorphous creatures that are biological in nature. Despite their apparent homogeneity, they are equipped with many of the same faculties as other living creatures, such as membranes, means of digestion, and ways to detect and react to stimuli. They are usually mindless, taking on the roles of dangerous traps and hazards to catch and devour unsuspecting victims. Intelligent Oozes are more active, often using their durability and physical properties to overwhelm their victims.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Plant
item.description: Plant creatures are made of plant matter. This group also encompasses Fungi. This group ranges from towering treants to carnivorous vines to networks of mycelium, but typically show off a high degree of symbiosis and adaptation to their environment and local creatures. It is often difficult to tell friend from foe apart in this group, as an unidentified pod could just as easily be a source of food as it could be a lure into a pit of thorny vines.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Titan
item.description: Titans are enormous, long-lived and usually ancient creatures similar to Humanoids. They are almost always intelligent, and often have their own societies and cultures. This is the realm of giants and mythical beasts of incredible proportions.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Undead
item.description:
Undead are souls wearing flesh that no longer lives, powered by foul magic that binds spirits into servitude beyond death. Respect for the dead in many cultures comes from experience of what happens when the dead are desecrated, as lynching, mass murders, fires, and other horrific deaths where the death is not properly honored can result in the creation of naturally-occurring undead.
Undead created naturally typically have unfinished business, obsessions, or grudges against those that wronged them. They are often lucid of the facts surrounding their demise, and do everything in their power to correct their qualms - after which they must be put to rest.
Undead created by outside forces are constantly suffering a cruel fate, forced to live in broken bodies and without a will of their own. Casters that engage in this magic must be wary, as every day that passes runs the risk of letting the latent memories in these spirits manifest into wills of their own with their only desire being to destroy the caster that enslaved them. In the same vein, a caster that respects the wishes of a created undead can use their unfinished desires to their advantage, using alliances over enslavement to form lasting bonds until they are put to rest.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Bestiary
item.description:
The Bestiary is a collection of creatures that populate the world, usually as fighting threats.
The bestiary is separated into 2 sections: Monster Qualities and the monsters themselves. Monster Qualities are not always exclusive to bestiary creatures, but are much more common on them. Many qualities that appear frequently are not described in bestiary entries and are instead described there in order to save time/space.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Monster Quality
item.description:
Monster Qualities are abilities, such as techniques or senses, that are most common on non-player creatures.
This is a list of common special abilities and their descriptions, used to save space on bestiary entries.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Achievement
item.description: Achievements are archetypal tasks that provide some kind of tangible benefit after completion. You do not need to opt into an achievement, instead they can be claimed retroactively after accomplishing a task.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Backstabber
item.description:
Achievement
Requirement - Murder 3 people you once considered allies, or who at thought you were an ally (before you turned on them). If you murder someone in a position of great power, like a powerful guild leader or king, it counts as 3.
Reward - You have a 6th sense for when people trust you. By observing how they react to your presence in a brief interaction (such as an introduction), you can tell whether they trust you, are indifferent towards you or if they distrust you.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Battle Scars
item.description:
Achievement
Requirement - Get defeated by a critical hit and survive in 3 different encounters. Or get crit 3 times in the same combat and survive.
Reward - The scars you get from battle are deeply entrenched in your memory. Your memories of combats you have encountered cannot be magically removed. By touching them, you can perfectly recall past events, as long as they happened in the thick of combat. Other creatures can touch your scars to share in the experience of the memory
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Critical Pet
item.description:
Achievement
Requirement - Use stealth to initiate combat on a creature by patting its head 3 times. This pat can have no mechanical effect such as delivering a spell or attacking.
Reward - You unlock the "Pet" skill. It uses your stealth bonus. If you sneak up on a creature and pet their head (again, no additional mechanical effect), you establish dominance, giving you a +2 bonus to skills for the subsequent social or combat encounter. If a creature within reach is smaller than you, you can pet them as a free action 1/turn for no mechanical benefit (no save).
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Archetype
item.description:
A Class Archetype is a specific branch of thematic abilities that are added to the original class.
Unless otherwise stated, nothing is lost or replaced by selecting an Archetype.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Character Creation
item.description:
There are several things for you to decide when deciding what you're writing down on your character sheet. Start with a theme, aesthetic, fighting style, or a particular character type you want to mimic from popular media.
These are in order of necessity for actually playing the game, but not necessarily in the order that is most convenient to any individual's workflow.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Class
item.description:
Classes are the fundamental basis from which you obtain abilities.
Classes get a set of numerical bonuses to aid them. Every class has listed HP, Skills, Mana, and at least one Save bonus. Stats can be flat front-loaded amounts, per-LV bonuses, or both.
Most characters will get their core abilities front-loaded at level 1. All classes get access to some type of Techniques, which can be martial techniques or spells. Technique points granted through class usually have some form of restriction.
Even levels are mostly dedicated to class features that directly increase the classes power. This includes gaining access to new combat abilities, increasing the power of old ones, and getting their own special attacks.
Odd levels are mostly dedicated to getting the next tier of techniques. As such, class features are usually sparse. If any are included, they are usually minor increases in power or they are flavorful inclusions. You also get a Feat every odd level.
Most classes require selecting an Archetype at level 1, which grants more specific thematic abilities.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Progression Outside of Class
item.description:
Boons/Banes - Gained at level one as a result of having positive or negative luck.
Feats - Gained at level 1, and every odd level after.
Technique Points - Gain one that can be used on any school of techniques at level 2, and every even level after.
Achievement - Can be gained at any time, even retroactively, when certain conditions are met, varying based on the achievement.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Concealment
item.description:
Concealment is a Circumstance that is gained when a creature's position is being obscured from another's Senses.
Usually, this means an effect like fog or darkness is partially or totally hiding a creature from another, resulting in Partial Concealment or Total Concealment, but this may take other forms against creatures that have other senses.
Concealment is a condition that's relative to the senses of other creatures. If you have Dark Vision and your opponent doesn't in a situation with Darkness, you have concealment against them, but they don't have concealment to you.
Attacking from concealment, even Total Concealment, does not Surprise❗ by default. You still need to use Stealth as normal.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Cover/Concealment.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Cover
item.description:
Cover is an environmental Circumstance that increases your AC and Reflex by 4.
Standard Cover is received against Ranged Attacks and AoEs that target you while there are obstacles between you and the source of the attack that obscure a large portion of your space, and that cannot be pierced by the attack.
Better forms of cover result in Improved Cover and Total Cover.
Examples include peeking around a pillar, over a trench, or behind a low wall.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Cover/Cover.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Improved Cover
item.description:
Improved Cover is an environmental Circumstance that increases your AC and Reflex by 8.
Improved Cover is received against Ranged Attacks and AoEs that target you while there are obstacles between you and the source of the attack that obscure almost all of your space, usually intentionally designed to allow attacks only in one direction, and that cannot be pierced by the attack.
Examples include arrow slits and murder holes., as well as ranged weapon attacks against Submerged targets.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Cover/Improved Cover.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Partial Concealment
item.description:
Partial Concealment is a Circumstance that grants +4 AC.
When you have Partial Concealment, a creature can still see you, but in a limited capacity. Either they can only see your shadow, they're trying to avert your gaze, or there are poor environmental conditions/magic at play.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Cover/Partial Concealment.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Total Concealment
item.description:
Total Concealment is a Circumstance that grants +10 AC.
When you have Total Concealment, a creature cannot see you at all. Either they are Blinded, you are completely hidden in an environmental or magical effect, or you are Invisible.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Cover/Total Concealment.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Total Cover
item.description:
Total Cover is an environmental Circumstance that makes you Untargetable.
Total Cover is received against Ranged Attacks, AoEs, and Targeted Abilities that target you while there are obstacles between you and the source of the attack that leave no way to reach you, and that cannot be pierced by the attack (in the case of Ranged Attacks and Area Effects.)
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Cover/Total Cover.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Abbreviations
item.description:
AC - Avoidability Capacity AKA Avoidability or Avoid
ACC - Accuracy
AoE - Area of Effect
CC - Debilitating Status AKA Crowd Control
DM - Dungeon Master
HP - Hit Points
LV - Level
NPC - Non-Player Character
PC - Player Character
CHA - Charisma
DEX - Dexterity
INT - Intelligence
LUK - Luck
STR - Strength
WIS - Wisdom
AoO - Attack of Opportunity
AS - Attack Speed
Crit - Critical Hit
DC - Difficulty Class AKA Target Number
Dismissible - Dismissible
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Abbreviations.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: AC
item.description:
Avoidability Capacity (AC) is the measure of how difficult it is to hit you. Targets must meet or exceed your AC with an Attack to Damage you or succeed at a Combat Maneuver.
By default, your starting AC is 10, and you add your LV, DEX, LUK, and Armor, and adjust it based on Circumstance.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/AC.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: ACC
item.description:
Accuracy (ACC): What you add to your Attacks to beat a target's AC.
By default, you add your LV, DEX, and bonuses from your Class to your accuracy.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/ACC.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: AoE
item.description:
Stands for "Area of Effect." It is used as shorthand to describe an attack that affects a wide area, such as an explosion, or a line of fire from a dragon's breath.
Area attacks have a point of origin. When the origin is a creature, such as with a breath weapon, determine Cover from one specific point in its occupied space. If the origin is a targeted point in space, such as with an explosion radiating outward, that point should be used to determine cover.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/AoE.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: CC
item.description: A Debilitating Status (CC) is one that impedes your movement or prevents you from taking actions normally.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/CC.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Circumstance
item.description:
Circumstance is any in-game situation, event, or position that conditionally applies a bonus, penalty, or Status to a creature.
Circumstances can apply to different creatures in different ways, usually based on positioning or the presence or absence of abilities - for example, having a low wall to grant you Cover will work for any creatures on the other side of the wall, but not on the same side as you. One creature may see you while you're in a cloud, while another cannot. You may be above one creature, but another creature may be above you. Therefore, these effects are circumstantial.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Circumstance.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: DC
item.description: Difficulty Class (DC) is the target number that a Roll must reach to be considered a success.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/DC.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: DM
item.description: Dungeon Master (DM): The person running the game. This person is the arbiter of the rules, tasked with creating the world, playing all NPCs, and ensuring a fun and fair experience for the players.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/DM.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: DR
item.description:
Damage Reduction (DR) is a rare form of defense that reduces incoming damage by a flat amount, noted as a value (DR x). If not specified, DR applies to physical damage, and DRA applies to all Damage types. All DR stacks.
Stacking defenses works in the way that protects the most - such as applying DR after Resistance. If an effect's damage is reduced to 0 with DR, then any associated non-damaging effects are negated.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/DR.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Flanking
item.description: Flanking is a Circumstance that grants +2 ACC against a target that you and an ally are Threatening from opposite sides.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Flanking.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Initiative
item.description:
As a Turn-Based Game, Initiative decides who goes first.
Initiative is d10+Reflex. Some bonuses apply specifically to Initiative.
Whoever rolls higher goes first. Ties are broken first by the higher bonus, then PCs take priority.
In the event where there are two parties that don't immediately fight, initiative starts when someone takes an aggressive action, such as casting a spell or drawing an arrow. In these cases, where both parties are aware of each other, initiative gets rolled immediately before any actions happen, but the individual that took the aggressive action gains a +10 bonus to their Initiative. This means being the first to say "I attack!" usually means going first.
Certain types of underhanded tactics can affect who goes first, such as using Hands to draw a concealed weapon or Deception for a sucker punch.
Anyone that is not aware of combat is placed below anyone that was aware when initiative was rolled, regardless of their initiative result. This usually happens as a result of Stealth or an attack against sleeping opponents.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Initiative.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Lv
item.description: Level (LV): the level assigned to a creature or effect is used to represent their relative strength in the setting. Level is added to all Rolls (Attacks, Saving Throws, Skills, etc.)
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Lv.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Minion
item.description:
Minion is a Circumstantial label assigned to a creature as it relates to another. A creature that is 1/3 of the level of another or lower is a Minion compared to it.
A level 0 creature is always considered a Minion to any creature of a higher level.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Minion.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Natural
item.description: A Natural result on a Roll is the result without any bonuses or penalties.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Natural.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: NPC
item.description:
Non-Player Character (NPC): Any character that is played by the DM.
These characters usually get placed after PCs to favor the players.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/NPC.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: PC
item.description:
Player Character (PC): A character controlled by a player, and not the DM. Players are the main characters of a story, and thus gain port priority in some aspects.
Sometimes, a DM will play a special character alongside the players that is treated like a PC. This is normal, but the players can veto such a character's PC status if they feel it is inappropriate.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/PC.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Potency
item.description:
Potency is the default DC of abilities used by a creature.
This is usually 10+LV+LUK.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Potency.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Roll
item.description:
The default die roll for resolving things. This is used to determine the variance expected.
In Malon's Marvelous Misadventures, this is a 15-sided die, rolled until a result of a Natural 1 shows up. The amount of rolls (including the one that results in the natural 1) is totaled as the result. For example, if it took 12 rolls, then the result of this "roll" is 12.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Roll.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: SP
item.description:
Many Spell and similar abilities have their variable effects based on Spell Power.
Spell Power is decided by your Staff of choice (usually d6) plus your INT.
Spells often include Spell Power in their total damage. When they do, they may also add Spell Power when Upcast.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/SP.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Threaten
item.description: The area a creature threatens represents where they can make attacks. This usually only applies to melee attacks. This area also marks where it is typically not safe to perform certain actions, or risk getting hit with an AoO.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Threaten.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: XP
item.description:
Experience is a meta-currency gained through prioritizing primary campaign events that allows players to influence the story/chronological order of things in order to accomplish personal goals quickly and get back into the action faster. As a baseline, 10 XP is the equivalent of one in-game day of events.
Experience is rewarded for spending time working towards campaign goals in an active manner. This mainly means exploring dungeons, splitting heads, and overthrowing governments - anything that is both related to the main campaign objectives, and is not part of downtime events (such as recovering from an Affliction or Crafting). XP is rewarded based on the time required to complete the mission, with additional bonuses for overcoming particular challenges.
The purpose of XP is to reward taking action. While downtime is an important part of roleplay, it's easy to justify staying in town making safe money or doing side quests to save up for a shiny new weapon or achieve personal goals if there isn't an obvious time constraint on important story events. It's easy to hold off on an important event and try to squeeze a few more days of crafting into your schedule.
Instead, XP serves to reward taking action immediately, without penalizing downtime events like crafting.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/XP.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Ability Scores
item.description:
These are representations of a creature's innate or cultivated affinities. These represent the mind, body, and spirit. The ability scores are Strength, Dexterity, Luck, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma.
Every Player Character gets 3 points to increase their ability scores as they wish, starting from 0 in each.
You can decrease a single ability score to -1 in order to gain an additional point. The maximum points you can invest in a given ability score is 2.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/Ability Scores.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Carry Weight
item.description:
A creature's Carry Weight represents what it is capable of lifting and moving around with without much effort.
The default value is 100, but some factors may change this.
A creature can lift and drag twice as much as their carry weight, but is staggered while doing so.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/Carry Weight.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: DEX
item.description:
Dexterity (DEX): Your agility, hand-eye coordination, and general sneakiness.
You add DEX to your Reflex Save.
You add your DEX to your ACC and AC.
You add DEX to Initiative.
Every point of DEX adds +5 to your Speed and Jump.
Negative DEX subtracts from these values.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/DEX.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: INT
item.description:
Intelligence (INT): Your knowledge, magical expertise, and logic capacity.
You add INT to SP
You gain an additional Technique Point.
You gain an additional Skill Proficiency per point of INT
You gain two additional Languages per point of INT (listed in the Skills section under Linguistics)
Negative INT subtracts from Spell Power
You lose a Skill Proficiency per negative INT
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/INT.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Luck Check
item.description: When the chance something will happen or fail to happen is based purely on chance, you attempt a Luck Check. You just roll a d10, add (or subtract) LUK and compare the result on the die to the DC.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/Luck Check.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: LUK
item.description:
Luck (LUK): Your ability to turn tides and benefit from unlikely outcomes.
You add LUK to Avoid.
You add LUK to Potency.
You add LUK to Luck Checks.
You add LUK to Critical Damage.
You can add LUK to a Roll as an Immediate Action (that did not already add LUK).
Negative LUK subtracts from Avoid, Potency, Luck Checks, and Critical Damage.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/LUK.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: STR
item.description:
Strength (STR): Your fortitude, athleticism, and endurance.
You add STR to your Fortitude Save.
You add STR to physical attack Damage, such as with weapons and unarmed attacks.
When you wield a weapon in two hands, you add twice your STR to damage.
You add STR to ACC when using a Combat Maneuver.
Every point of STR increases your Carry Weight by 50%.
Negative STR subtracts from your Fortitude Saves.
Negative STR halves your Carry Weight.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/STR.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: WIS
item.description:
Wisdom (WIS): Your faith, decision making, habits, diligence, and discipline.
You add WIS to your Will Save.
You add WIS to your Mana.
You gain 50% more XP per point of WIS.
You gain a Feat per Wisdom.
Negative WIS subtracts from your Will Save, Feats, and reduces your XP gain to 50%.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/WIS.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Burrow
item.description:
Burrow Speeds allow Movement through dirt, clay, and other particulate turf, but not solid rocks (unless otherwise stated). Burrowing leaves a temporary hole the size of the creature that burrowed for a few rounds, depending on the sediment type, unless the creature takes measures to avoid this.
Starting to burrow is a Swift Action that Provokes as if leaving a Threatened space.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Movement/Burrow.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Difficult Terrain
item.description: Difficult Terrain is a Circumstance that represents reduced movement due to physical blockage. This can be because of wading through knee-deep mud, flying through dense brush, or burrowing through particularly rocky turf.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Movement/Difficult Terrain.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fly
item.description:
Fly Speeds allow Movement in any direction. They may remain in the air as long as they have a Fly Speed - Flying targets get +4 AC against Ranged Attacks while flying.
A creature that is Entangled or Grounded cannot continue flight.
A creature that takes damage from an Attack or AoE effect while flying receives Clumsy 1 until they land, up to 6 stacks.
Starting to fly is a Swift Action that Provokes as if leaving a Threatened space.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Movement/Fly.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Hover
item.description:
Hover Speeds allow Movement above solid and liquid surfaces while ignoring Difficult Terrain. They may remain in the air as long as they have a Fly Speed - Flying targets get +4 AC against Ranged Attacks while flying.
A creature that is Entangled or Grounded cannot continue flight.
A creature that takes damage from an Attack or AoE effect while flying receives Clumsy 1 until they land, up to 6 stacks.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Movement/Hover.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Movement
item.description:
You can move up to your Speed on your turn. Some abilities or effects may require spending a certain amount of your movement for the turn.
Abilities that move you do not cost or consume any of your movement unless otherwise stated.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Movement/Movement.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Speed
item.description:
Default ground movement speed is 30.
Race, Class, Equipment, and Status can change this.
Some actions grant extra speed.
You may have other forms of movement that manifest in terms of different Speeds - you may use multiple forms of movement on the same turn, but only up to the maximum amount for the given speed. Any slower speeds used overlap - That is, if you have a Fly 40 and a ground speed of 30, you may walk 30 feet and then fly another 10.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Movement/Speed.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Action System
item.description:
This game is played turn-based, with turn order determined at the start of the battle with an Initiative roll. The actions you can take on your turn are as follows.

Standard Action: This action occupies most of your turn, and you can perform one per turn.
Example: The Attack Action is the most common, allowing a series of smaller attacks up to your Attack Speed, executed in any order. Refer to the "Attack" section for more details.

Swift Action: This action can be executed during any other action, with a limit of one per turn.
Free Action: These actions are effortless or part of other actions, allowing you to perform as many as you wish per turn - within reason.
Full-Round Action: This action requires the use of your standard action and all of your free Movement. You may still move if you have an ability that allows extra movement as a different action.

When it's not your turn, you can take the following actions:

Immediate Action: A Swift Action that can occur off-turn. Limited to one per round, shared with Swift Action — you cannot use both in the same round.
Instant Action: A Free Action that can occur off-turn. Referred to as "Instantly" in abilities.
Attack of Opportunity: A response triggered by certain actions of others. Limited to one per round. When a creature "Provokes," they are engaging in an action that allows others to AoO them.
Movement: You can move up to your Speed on your turn. Some abilities or effects may require spending a certain amount of your movement for the turn. You may have other forms of movement that manifest in terms of different Speeds - you may use multiple forms of movement on the same turn, but only up to the maximum amount for the given speed. Any slower speeds used overlap - That is, if you have a Fly 40 and a ground speed of 30, you may walk 30 feet and then fly another 10.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Action System.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: AoO
item.description:
Attack of Opportunity (AoO): An Instant Action Attack triggered in response to certain actions of others. All creatures can do this once per round by default. When a creature "Provokes," they are engaging in an action that allows others to AoO them.
Movement can only provoke once from a given creature per turn.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/AoO.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Free Action
item.description:
Free Action: These actions are effortless or part of other actions, allowing you to perform as many as you wish per turn - within reason.
See:
Delay
Swap Item
Monster Lore
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Free Action.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Full-Round Action
item.description: Full-Round Action: This action requires the use of your standard action and all of your free movement. You may still move if you have an ability that allows extra movement as a different action.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Full-Round Action.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Immediate Action
item.description: Immediate Action: A Swift Action that can occur off-turn. Limited to one per round, shared with Swift Action — you cannot use both in the same round.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Immediate Action.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Instant Action
item.description: Instant Action: A Free Action that can occur off-turn. Referred to as "Instantly" in abilities.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Instant Action.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Standard Action
item.description:
Standard Action: This action occupies most of your turn, and you can perform one per turn.
Example: The Attack Action is the most common, allowing a series of smaller attacks up to your Attack Speed, executed in any order. Refer to the "Attack" section for more details.
See:
Administer Potion
Aid
Attack Action
Carry
Charge
Dash
Disengage
Prepare
Total Defense
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Standard Action.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Swift Action
item.description:
Swift Action: This action can be executed during any other action, with a limit of one per turn.

See:
Hide
Jump
Use Potion
Recharge Abilities
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Swift Action.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Carry
item.description: Carrying an ally allows you to move them with your movement. You must be able to lift the ally, or drag them treating all terrain as difficult terrain. You must use this action every turn you carry an ally. The creature you carry becomes clumsy 2 unless they are defeated or you aren't in combat.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Carry.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Charge
item.description: Move up to your speed in a straight line, and then make an attack.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Charge.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dash
item.description: Double your speed this round.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Dash.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Disengage
item.description: Your movement is Elusive this turn.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Disengage.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Prepare
item.description:
You can prepare swift actions, movement, free actions and standard actions to react to a specific triggering event (Ex: “a goblin opens this door, I walk up to him and shove him off the cliff”). If the triggering action never happens, you don't get your actions back.
When you prepare a standard action to attack, you can only prepare a single attack.
You cannot prepare actions outside of Initiative.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Prepare.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Total Defense
item.description: Get +4 to AC and Saves until the start of your next turn. Remove all Clumsy stacks. You can't make an AoO while using Total Defense.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Total Defense.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Jump
item.description:
Jump in a straight line. This can only be used in combination with other forms of movement such as walking or charging.
Jump is also a statistic. By default, your Jump is 5. This is a measure of distance, specifically for horizontal jumps, while vertical jumps are half. This does not give you additional movement, and the thus it is limited by your Speed, unless your Jump is higher than your Speed (in which case it functions as your total movement limit when jumping). It can be used to avoid Difficult Terrain, but not if you're already in the Difficult Terrain.
You can only jump once with this action. If you Dash, you can jump twice. These jumps do not need to be consecutive.
Jump distance increases by 5 ft per point of DEX (and STR with Athletics).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Swift Actions/Jump.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Recharge Abilities
item.description:
Regain all uses of your Recharge abilities.
When you use this action, you cannot use it again for one minute.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Swift Actions/Recharge Abilities.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Use Potion
item.description: Retrieve and drink a potion.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Swift Actions/Use Potion.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Alternative Win Conditions
item.description:
For when killing everything that moves isn't what you want, alternative win conditions seek to answer the question of "How do I end combat without reducing the enemy hp to 0?"
See:
Restraint
Surrender and Morale
Truce
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Alternative Win Conditions/Alternative Win Conditions.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Restraint
item.description:
#Cuffs #Rope #Container
When creatures don't surrender, but you don’t want to risk killing them, restraints can be used to end the fight. Some situations can naturally be neutralized by dropping a cage in the right place, but such conveniences are rare. More often than not, restraining your foe is going to involves rope and cuffs.
#Cuffs
Grabbing and already-grabbed creature allows you to put cuffs on them.
One grab is needed per appendage cuffed. You cannot cuff a creature on your own unless you can grab multiple times per turn, in which case you need another free hand. This provokes AoO.
