This completely prevents the use of their arms outside of simple item interactions. Cuffs can also be placed on the legs to reduce a creatures speed to 15. Combat maneuvers made against a cuffed creature gain a +10 bonus.
Cuffs are difficult to escape, and even harder to break. They typically require outside assistance in order to be removed. Because cuffs are typically made from iron and steel, they can take a significant beating.
DC to break (Athletics) or lockpick (Hands) is dependent on the type of material and the lock. A typical forged cuff is DC 40 to break, or 20 to pick.
Creatures that are bound can try to free themselves, but take a -5 penalty.
#Rope
Grabbing and already-grabbed creature allows you to tie them with rope.
One grab is needed per appendage tied. You cannot tie up a creature on your own unless you can grab multiple times per turn, in which case you need another free hand. This provokes AoO.
Rope is easier to destroy than cuffs, but it is also easier to make the restraint more intense. By grabbing one more time, you can prevent the creature from acting completely.
Rope tends to be a good way to bind singular creatures, since anybody with a sharp implement can handily free a bound creature.
Rope can be destroyed with an attack from any slashing weapon. Using Athletics or Acrobatics, you can pull the ropes apart, but the DC is determined by the athletics bonus of the creature who bound you (30+their athletics bonus). Creatures that are bound can try to free themselves, but take a -5 penalty. This penalty can be ignored with a natural attack suitable for freeing yourself, or a slashing concealed weapon.
#Container
Grabbing and already-grabbed creature allows you to forcefully shove them into an object within reach such as a bag, barrel, or box, so long as they can handily fit in the object.
Whether or not they can escape generally depends on the object and the tools the captured creature has on hand. Wooden crates don’t do to well when trying to hold barbarians or crafty characters with crowbars.
DC to break (Athletics) is dependent on the type of material. Some objects can be handily dealt with, not requiring a skill check. A knife makes quick work of a bag, and given enough space, hammers break boxes.
Creatures that are bound can try to free themselves, but take a -5 penalty.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Alternative Win Conditions/Restraint.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Surrender and Morale
item.description:
During combat there come times when you do not wish to fight, usually when one side is close to victory, but can also happen when creatures are clearly outnumbered or outmatched.
How well a surrender feels in a situation usually comes down to a gut feeling, affected by a lot of variables. In order to even consider a surrender to be viable, one or more of the following (or other applicable) conditions should be met…
Numbers advantage
Some other clear advantage, such as terrain, positioning, equipment or a powerful noteworthy ally
Heavily damaged or unconscious allies
Consequences for not surrendering (often death or further prosecution)
Hostages
Whether or not creatures are minions or named characters
A surrender requires clear communication, which may not always be possible given the hectic and spread out nature of battle. Some creatures, particularly mindless ones, will not surrender unless specific circumstances are met. Creatures of animal intelligence can be convinced to surrender if you can speak to animals or have wild empathy etc.
Surrender can mean forfeiting weapons, fleeing in fear, begging for mercy or something similar. If not all individuals accept the surrender, then the fight continues until they do.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Alternative Win Conditions/Surrender and Morale.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Truce
item.description:
In situations where there are two opposing sides that are generally neutral towards each other or even allies with each other, you can call for a truce. This generally requires important information (we were sent by the merchants guild), certification from an important or recognizable organization (legal documentation) or a special item (an artifact or flag).
It could also be appropriate to call for a truce if you are delving into a dungeon and encounter another party, so long as you aren't after the same thing. You might not cooperate, but at least you won't be killing each other. If more information is revealed by talking throughout a battle (wait you're also hunting for the garbooni?), you can also reasonably call for a truce.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Alternative Win Conditions/Truce.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Action-Attack
item.description: Action-Attacks are actions that can either be used as a Standard Action or as an attack with an AS of 1.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Action-Attack.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Combat Maneuver
item.description:
Combat Maneuvers are Action-Attack that target AC. AC should have separate notes for bonuses towards specific maneuvers. You add both STR and DEX to these attacks, rather than just DEX. When making a Combat Maneuver, you must decide which specific form it takes, such as a Fell, Dirty Trick, or Shove. A successful Combat Maneuver will inflict a condition based on the form you chose.
Combat Maneuvers can sometimes benefit from rolling a Critical Hit, by augmenting its power instead of its damage.
See:
Dirty Trick
Disarm
Drag
Feint
Fell
Grab
Shove
Steal
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Combat Maneuver.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dirty Trick
item.description: Apply clumsy 2, sickened 2 or blurred vision to a creature. They must spend a standard action to get rid of the condition.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Dirty Trick.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Disarm
item.description: Knock a held item out of a creature’s hand, landing at their feet. It takes 30 ft of Movement or a Standard Action to pick up an item off the ground, which Provokes.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Disarm.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Feint
item.description:
Feint is the use of Deception vs the target's Insight.
Feint is NOT considered an Attack, but you can still use your ACC in place of Deception. It is still classified as a Combat Maneuver, and can benefit from any bonuses or defenses relevant to them.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Feint.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Shove
item.description:
Push the target 10ft away from you.
On Crit, add an additional 10ft.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Shove.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Steal
item.description:
You take an item that is not in the target's hands, but is otherwise accessible on their person.
Steal can use Hands in place of ACC.
Worn Equipment is assumed to be ineligible targets unless it is an Accessory.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Steal.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: AS
item.description:
Attack Speed (AS): In order to decide how many attacks to make, you must use the AS of anything available to you when you take your Attack Action. Most weapons have an AS greater than 1, allowing you to make multiple attacks. If you have multiple ways to attack, you can combine them together. However, you cannot "overlap" your AS. To visualize this -

Here we have a character that has a dagger in hand with an AS of 5, a mace in the other with an AS of 3, and multiple Action-Attacks with an AS of 1. He can take one action from every column, meaning if you use a Spell (AS-1) you can no longer do any attacks that use the same column. He could do

5 dagger attacks
4 dagger attacks and a Spell
a Special Attack and 2 mace attacks and 2 dagger attacks, etc...
However, he cannot do a Spell and a Special Attack on the same turn, as they only have an AS of 1 individually.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Crit
item.description:
Critical Hit: an Attack that adds Critical Damage.
Normally, this is a result of rolling an attack and beating their AC by 20 or more.
Other abilities may change the conditions needed to score a Critical Hit.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Critical Damage
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Critical Damage.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dual Wielding
item.description: When using something in each hand, you gain the full benefits of both. You may benefit from two staves granting casting bonuses, use both of their AS, a sword and shield - whatever you like. If you use two weapons of the same AS, they gain +1 AS. Both weapons must be used at least once. You cannot engage in Dual-Wielding if you have a Two-Handed item. For example, you cannot swing a greatsword and then use Unarmed Strikes or throw shuriken with their higher AS.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Dual Wielding.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Line of Effect
item.description: A straight line between two places with no Total Cover or impassable obstacles for a given effect grants Line of Effect. This is different from sight, as you may be able to see someone and not Target them (such as through a window).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Line of Effect.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Offense Calculator
item.description:
Hit Chance = 19.09%
Attack Power = 22
Target's Defense Power = 638.8
Time to Kill = 29.04 Rounds
This Time to Kill formula is not accurate for Hit Chances above 100%.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Offense Calculator.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Ranged Attack
item.description:
A Ranged Attack is an Attack made with ranged targeting. This means you can make the attack up to the listed range, not limited by the space you Threaten. These attacks can also be penalized due to Cover. Physical Ranged Attacks have two listed ranges - the first is Close Range and the second is Long Range.
Making a Ranged Attack Provokes.
Abilities that function from a distance but do not use an Attack Roll are not Ranged Attacks.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Ranged Attack.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Switching Weapons
item.description:
At the start of your turn, you can decide what's in your hands from your inventory. You can draw and put away any weapons without penalty. This is a Free Action as long as it's done at the start of your turn. If you decide to change what you're wielding at another point in your turn, it becomes a Swift Action - and you can't do both.
Handedness is an important concept here. When you use your hand for something other than a free action, you usually cannot use it for something else on the same turn. The main exception to this is Two-Handed items, which allow you to let go with one hand to perform an action. Any other exceptions should be handled with discretion.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Switching Weapons.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Targeted
item.description: A Targeted ability refers to one where you must select targets to apply the effect, which is not an Attack Roll. Some abilities are particular about what they work on, and will fail if used outside of their scope. You must have Line of Effect and be able to see your target to target them. If you cannot see them, you must target their space with the intention of targeting them.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Ashen One
item.description:
In dark souls, certain types of creatures, namely the player character, hold a special place in the world's lore. When you die you don't reload the game, you canonically respawn at the location you last rested, leaving behind all your money where you died.
You could choose to adopt a similar system where certain types of conditions need to be met for these unique creatures to die for real. Having the characters lose all their money might not be the best approach for a TTRPG: players like their money. But, in souls games you can go back to the place you died and collect the money again, so maybe.
This kind of natural respawn mechanic is a good fit for campaigns where you expect your players to encounter dangerous creatures on the regular and your players don't get too discouraged from losing. Meat grinder without the consequences of losing your character for good.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Death and Resurrection/Ashen One.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Cloning Device
item.description:
You start off your adventures waking up in some alchemist's lab, surrounded in copies of yourself. Whenever you die, there is a fresh body waiting for you back at the lab that your soul gets sucked into.
This plays more into having a secret base type thing, and it feels a little less metagame-y than "chosen by god." it also has an interesting mystery component to it. Why were you guys chosen as clones? Whose lab is this? How's that for storytelling with resurrection?
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Death and Resurrection/Cloning Device.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Death and Resurrection
item.description:
The purpose of resurrection in TTRPGs is primarily for the benefit of the players. If a DM makes frequent use of the resurrection spells for entities that the players went to great lengths to kill, it heavily undermines their effort and feels terrible, even if plausible.
The powers that be should instead be very particular about the who gets a second chance. If the players are the main character of the story, then the game's resurrection mechanics should treat them as such. As a replacement for most resurrection effects, use these rules instead. Or don't use resurrection at all. It's your game. Whatever.
IMPORTANT NOTE: Please make sure your players are on board with whatever you decide. Nobody likes surprise mechanics.
See:
Ashen One
Cloning Device
Limited Resurrection
Tombstone
Withers
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Death and Resurrection/Death and Resurrection.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Limited Resurrection
item.description:
Pose a caveat to resurrection magic that imposes a severely limiting factor, such as only being able to revive a creature shortly after it died with some kind of resource attached to it. Maybe even make it a limited resource by tying it to physical items, like scrolls with this effect attached to it.
EFFECT

DESCRIPTION You breathe new life into a recently deceased creature. If the creature has died within the last minute, they are brought back to life at 1 hp and drained 1.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Death and Resurrection/Limited Resurrection.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Tombstone
item.description:
In the event of your characters untimely demise, worry not, for the gods smile upon you. When killed, your body becomes a tombstone with your name and face on it. It weighs as much as you did, including all of your equipment. This tombstone can be carried back somewhere to perform a ritual and bring the character back to life.
This can be a place of significance to this god, something generic like a church or something with more story relevance. It can be wherever home base is, or you can require the players to reach certain points in the campaign in order to get their characters resurrected (Ex: Your friend died by the lich's hand, and now, to get them back, you have to destroy his phylactery. Make a temp character!).
The basic idea is there: satisfy this entity's conditions and life will be restored.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Death and Resurrection/Tombstone.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Withers
item.description:
In Baldur's Gate 3, there is an NPC that shows up in your camp that has a vested interest in your success. He has powers that aren't like normal characters, chief among them the ability to resurrect fallen allies. You could easily introduce a similar character into your campaign, maybe even the introduction to the campaign is this NPC resurrecting the players.
This particular method has the benefit of being less nebulous than divine forces. It gives someone the players can interact with and someone that can give them direction. Whatever the reason they have for resurrecting your players, it's because they need their help.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Death and Resurrection/Withers.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Defeat
item.description:
When a creature falls to 0 HP, they gain the Defeated condition. They cannot do anything more than a mild whisper while at or below 0 HP. If they are healed to positive hit points, they do not lose the Defeated condition, but they may Crawl at a rate of 10 feet per turn, or move at full speed when assisted by another creature.
This mostly only applies to important characters. A character is important when the players or DM say so (often the player characters themselves, an NPC relevant to the story, or a major villain). When an important character defeats an unimportant character, it is assumed they are killed outright unless otherwise stated by the characters attacking.
If a creature reaches an amount of negative HP equal to its maximum HP, it dies outright regardless of its importance.
See Recovering from Defeat.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Healing
item.description: Healing is an effect that restores current HP up to your maximum HP, grants Temp HP, or removes debilitating status conditions.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Immunity
item.description: Having an Immunity represents that a particular Damage type or classification of ability has no effect on you.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Long Rest
item.description:
Taking a Long Rest requires being in a place with no immediate threats or hazards for at least 8 hours, during which you sleep to benefit from Natural Healing.
Proper rest requires being in a safe environment with the minimum necessary accommodations to not ache in one's sleep. Lacking any of these requirements results in only restoring half of one's missing HP, or less if the situation is worse, at the DM's discretion. If you are interrupted but spent at least 15 minutes resting, it counts as a Short Rest.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Hitpoints/Long Rest.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Recovering from Defeat
item.description:
After being Defeated for an hour after the last time it took damage, a creature may attempt to shake off the condition with a STR Roll. On a 10 or higher, they lose the Defeated condition, but as long as their HP remains negative, they are Staggered. On a fail, they lose 5 HP.
After successfully recovering, the creature is Drained by d4-LUK. This drain cannot kill the creature.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Hitpoints/Recovering from Defeat.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Resistance
item.description: Having Resistance to a Damage type makes you take half damage from it.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Rest
item.description: Take a Short Rest or Long Rest.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Temp HP
item.description:
Temporary Hitpoints (Temp HP) are gained separately from your HP. They are lost before your HP, and multiple sources do not stack - only the highest applies.
Unless otherwise stated, Temp HP only lasts 1 minute.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Hitpoints/Temp HP.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Weakness
item.description: Having a Weakness means you take 50% more damage from Damage of that type, or have a -4 penalty to Saves against effects of a certain type if they are not damage.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Light Level
item.description:
Light comes in 3 forms.
Bright Light A sunny day or a torch lit room. Bright light let's creatures see things clearly. Most creatures can see in bright light without any penalty.
Dim Light Moonlight or at the edge of your torch light. Many humanoids cannot see well in dim light. Features in dim light appear only as a silhouette with dull, if any, color. Without special senses, creatures have Partial Concealment in dim light.
Darkness The depths of a cave or deep underwater. Few creatures can see clearly in a complete darkness. Some, such as humans, can't see at all. Those that can (such as with night vision or Darkvision) still only see in grayscale. Without special senses, creatures have Total Concealment in darkness.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/More Rules/Light Level.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Rounding Numbers
item.description: Always round decimals down, minimum 1.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/More Rules/Rounding Numbers.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Size and Reach
item.description:
This game is meant to be played on a grid of hexes or squares. Personally, I prefer hexes. Creatures must be represented in such a space. That's why creatures are broken up into size categories.

Creatures threaten all spaces they occupy by default.
You can enter the space of a creature that is a size category larger or smaller than you. If you leave a space occupied by a creature, it provokes an AoO as though you were leaving a threatened area. If you get attacked this way, the same creature can't also AoO you for leaving their threatened square in the same turn.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/More Rules/Size and Reach.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Stacking Damage and Defense
item.description:
When you stack a source of flat damage reduction and multiplicative reduction, add them together in the way that reduces the damage the most.
When you have multiple sources of increasing damage by a percentage, add the percentages together, do not multiply.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/More Rules/Stacking Damage and Defense.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: At-Will
item.description: An At-Will ability can be used as many times as desired, as long as you spend the appropriate actions (if any).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Recharging Abilities/At-Will.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Limited
item.description:
A Limited ability can only be used once, after which you must Long Rest to restore it.
If it is a Mana ability, such as a Technique or Spell, you can prepare a different slot with the ability to use it again.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Recharging Abilities/Limited.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Mana
item.description:
Mana Slots (Mana): All creatures have 2+LV Mana unless otherwise stated.
When selecting Techniques or Spell, each one takes up one Mana Slot, unless otherwise stated.
How you use a given slot is determined by whether the ability is At-Will, Recharge, or Limited.

At-Will abilities can be used as you like, without affecting the Mana Slot.
Recharge abilities will temporarily consume the slot until you use the Recharge Abilities action. You do not need to re-prepare the ability, it returns to the slot as if it was not spent once you use the recharge action.
Limited abilities will make you lose the slot until you Long Rest. This is sometimes referred to as Mana Burn. You can re-prepare the ability to assign it to a different slot and continue to use it.
When you learn abilities that must be assigned to a slot, you must Rest to assign them to those slots. A given ability can only be assigned once in your loadout. You can rest again to reassign your abilities.
Abilities gained through class features or items usually do not take up Mana Slots, and thus you cannot re-prepare your ability to a different slot if it's Limited.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Recharging Abilities/Mana.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Mana Burn
item.description:
Mana Burn is the loss of a daily Mana slot such that it cannot be recovered until you take a Long Rest, and needing to re-prepare the ability to another slot to use it again.
This is usually voluntary, but can also be the result of an offensive effect.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Recharging Abilities/Mana Burn.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Recharge
item.description: A Recharge ability can only be used once, after which you can use the Recharge Abilities action to restore it.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Recharging Abilities/Recharge.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fortitude
item.description:
Fortitude Saves are one of the three primary Saves Rolled to avoid a negative effect.
Your Fortitude represents your resistance to physical hardship, such as Poison, Disease, and concussive attacks.
You add STR and LV to your Fortitude, as well as any bonuses from your Class.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Saving Throws/Fortitude.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Reflex
item.description:
Reflex Saves are one of the three primary Saves Rolled to avoid a negative effect.
Your Reflex represents your reactions and ability to evade or mitigate sudden attacks such as Area Effects and Traps.
You add DEX and LV to your Reflex, as well as any bonuses from your Class.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Saving Throws/Reflex.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Saving Throw
item.description:
Saving Throws (Saves) are Rolls decide the effectiveness of abilities or effects that do not require an Attack. It is typically the affected creature that rolls the save. In order to consider a saving throw a pass, the affected creature must roll higher than the DC of the effect.
The DC of a Saving Throw is usually 10 plus the Level of the effect, or the attacking creature's Potency.
Saves come in 3 forms: Fortitude saves (based on STR), Reflex saves (based on DEX), and Will saves (based on WIS).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Saving Throws/Saving Throw.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Will
item.description:
Will Saves are one of the three primary Saves Rolled to avoid a negative effect.
Your Will represents your mental resilience and ability to resist mental attacks such as Illusions, mind control, and Fear.
You add WIS and LV to your Will, as well as any bonuses from your Class.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Saving Throws/Will.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Ablaze
item.description: When a creature is set Ablaze, it takes 2d8 Fire Damage at the end of each turn and suffers -2 AC. Before taking damage, it gets a Reflex save to end the effect. A creature can choose to inflict Knockdown on itself at the end of its turn for a +4 bonus to this save.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Ablaze.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Anchored
item.description: Creature cannot use Teleportation effects. If it attempts to, the action (and ability) is wasted.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Anchored.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Asleep
item.description:
Asleep: This creature is Knocked Down, can take no actions, and cannot be awakened unless it takes damage or an ally uses the Aid action to awaken them. The creature is also Surprised❗ and suffers -20 Perception.
If the creature is asleep through natural means, it can use perception to wake up by noticing something amiss.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Asleep.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Blinded
item.description: Sighted creature takes a -10 penalty to Perception and treats all creatures as though they had Total Concealment. Creatures' vision range decreases to 10 ft. Creature is also Surprised❗.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Blinded.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Blurred Vision
item.description: Sighted creature takes a -4 penalty to Perception and treats all creatures as though they had Partial Concealment.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Blurred Vision.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Charmed
item.description:
Creature cannot attack the entity that inflicted this condition. The entity that inflicted this condition has a +4 bonus on Charisma Skills against this creature.
This ends if the creature that inflicted the condition harms the charmed creature.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Charmed.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Chilled
item.description: Creature is covered in ice. Creature has -2 AC, Resistance to Fire Damage and -15 Speed. This status ends when they take physical or fire damage.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Chilled.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Clumsy
item.description: Creature takes a stacking penalty to Reflex and AC equal to the Clumsy value. This otherwise functions like Shaken. A Clumsy creature cannot ascend using Flight, or things that function similarly to flight, such as a Hover Speed.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Clumsy.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Confused
item.description: Creature considers all others enemies. Every turn, they roll d10+LUK to determine how they act. For confusion effects that last more than 1 round, each subsequent d10 roll gets 2 added to the result.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Confused.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Cursed
item.description: A Cursed creature is suffering from a permanent debilitating condition. Curses cannot be dispelled, but they all have some way to get rid of them. This usually requires some convoluted action most people wouldn't do unless prompted. Can be identified using the "identify curse or affliction" feature in the Medicine skill.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Cursed.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Defeated
item.description: A Defeated creature cannot do anything more than a mild whisper while at or below 0 HP. If they are at or are healed to positive hit points, they do not lose the Defeated condition, but they may crawl at a rate of 10 feet per turn, or move at full speed when another creature uses Aid. See Defeat.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Defeated.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dominated
item.description: A creature that is dominated is hit with a powerful charm effect, possessed, or controlled by some other means. They are unable to control their own actions and are subject to the will of another creature.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Dominated.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Entangled
item.description: Creature gets -2 AC, and their Speed is reduced to zero. This condition usually comes with a means to escape manually with Athletics. Creatures without the entangled condition receive a +5 bonus on checks to untangle a creature.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Entangled.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Entombed
item.description: The creature is encased in ice, stone etc. They have Total Cover and are Untargetable. Entombed creatures can only perform mental actions or try to escape (usually requiring an athletics check).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Entombed.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fascinated
item.description: Creature cannot take actions other than watch the source of its fascination. Creature loses this condition after it is attacked, has a Saving Throw inflicted on it, or succeeds on a Perception check to notice a creature in its pockets or otherwise taking an offensive action. If the source of its fascination is no longer visible (or able to be sensed for other types of fascination), the condition also ends. After this happens, the creature temporarily becomes immune to fascination for 1 minute.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Fascinated.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fatigued
item.description:
Cannot Charge or Dash. Jump is halved. -10 Athletics and Acrobatics.
Removed on a Short Rest.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Fatigued.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Frightened
item.description: Creature cannot move closer to the source of its fear. It has -6 ACC and opposed skill checks against the source of its fear.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Frightened.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Grounded
item.description: Through bent wings, malfunctioning magic, or disorientation, the creature is unable to stay airborne. Creatures currently flying immediately plummet and provoke AoOs, but retain enough flight to avoid Fall Damage. This also affects Hover speeds.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Grounded.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Held Down
item.description: Creature cannot stand from Prone.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Held Down.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Invincible
item.description: Creature's HP cannot be reduced.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Invincible.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Invisible
item.description: You cannot be detected by sight. This grants you Total Concealment against any creature that primarily uses sight. You must still use Stealth to hide your presence and specific location, or else creatures will still be able to attack your space to try and hit you.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Invisible.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Mindless
item.description:
Creature does not have any capacity for reasoning. It performs basic motions regardless of external stimuli.
This status grants immunity to many Mind-Affecting effects.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Mindless.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Necrosed
item.description: Healing effects that restore HP or grant Temp HP are half as effective (minimum 1 healing).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Necrosed.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Pacified
item.description: The creature cannot take aggressive actions against enemies with intent to inflict damage or assist its allies in inflicting damage.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Pacified.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Shaken
item.description:
Creature takes a penalty to Will and Potency equal to the Shaken value. Adding new stacks of Shaken gives all stacks the longest duration of all the effects.
Usually, Shaken wears off after 1 minute out of combat.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Shaken.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Sickened
item.description:
Creature takes a penalty to Fortitude and ACC equal to the Sickened value. Otherwise functions like Shaken.
Sickened usually wears off after 1 minute out of combat.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Sickened.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Silenced
item.description:
Creature cannot speak, including to cast Spell.
Spells that state an absence of speech can still be cast.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Silenced.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Staggered
item.description: Creature can only take a Standard Action or Swift Action each turn, not both. -15 Speed.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Staggered.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Stasis
item.description: Creature is frozen in time, or some other particularly powerful effect. They are Untargetable, Unassailable, Unstoppable and Invincible. They cannot take any actions unless otherwise stated.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Stasis.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Stunned
item.description: A more extreme form of being Dazed. Creature cannot take any actions or movement. Creature is Surprised❗.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Stunned.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Submerged
item.description: Target is completely surrounded in liquid. This triggers Aquatic Combat and Improved Cover.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Submerged.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Surprised
item.description:
Creature is unable to respond effectively to attacks due to Stealth, Feinting, or some other status or Circumstance. Attacks made against a Surprised creature get a +10 bonus.
This status effect is also a Circumstance that can be determined on a per-creature or per-attack basis, but can also be a condition that applies to all incoming attacks.
Creatures Surprised by the start of a combat also place below non-Surprised creatures regardless of Initiative result.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Surprised.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Time Out
item.description:
A creature in Time Out has lost the will to fight, and has surrendered to you. They cannot inflict harmful effects on anybody or anything. They also cannot cast spells without your permission. They meekly follow your commands (ex. follow me), but won’t do anything against their ethos (kick that puppy) or that is dangerous (jump off that cliff) without extreme circumstances. If you or your allies attack the creature or cast a harmful spell on it, the condition ends.
Treat it like a slightly more convenient form of unconsciousness if you want to interact with the creature after the combat. Many minion type creatures will acquire this status effect when their leader is defeated.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Time Out.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Unstoppable
item.description: Creature cannot be moved by force, and can move and take actions normally regardless of any status.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Unstoppable.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Untargetable
item.description: Creature cannot be targeted.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Untargetable.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Wet
item.description:
Gain weakness to Electric and Cold Damage. When a wet creature takes Electric or Cold damage, the condition ends.
Being wet is something that can come up often in the environment. Only by being drenched in heavy rain, submerged in water or something similar can one be considered wet to the point where this has a mechanical effect.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Wet.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Abnegation
item.description: These spells focus on disabling magic and protection.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/School Tags/Abnegation.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Conjuration
item.description: These spells focus on summoning, displacement, and temporary creation.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/School Tags/Conjuration.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Divination
item.description: These spells focus on gaining knowledge through spying and querying the universe.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/School Tags/Divination.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Evocation
item.description: These spells focus on the manipulating elements and focusing power to destructive effect.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/School Tags/Evocation.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Illusion
item.description:
These spells focus on warping perception to impose one's will over others.
Enchantment spells are Illusion spells that are also Mind-Affecting.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/School Tags/Illusion.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Transmutation
item.description: These spells focus on changing things into other things.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/School Tags/Transmutation.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Air
item.description:
Effect manipulates air to produce its effect.
This is a non-Damage elemental tag.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Bond
item.description: An effect with the Buff or Bond tag grants a boon to a creature, or a shared effect. If an unwilling creature has a buff or bond used on it, it can choose to deny it.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Buff
item.description: An effect with the Buff or Bond tag grants a boon to a creature, or a shared effect. If an unwilling creature has a buff or bond used on it, it can choose to deny it.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Caloric
item.description: Effect either creates Food, or has special interactions when using it.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Charm
item.description: Charm effects allow the creature inflicting it to exert some degree of control over others. All charm effects are also Mind-Affecting.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Concentration
item.description:
An effect with the Concentration tag requires some degree of upkeep from the caster and typically has a duration. Concentration effects end if the caster is Defeated, Stunned, put Asleep, or otherwise completely prevented from taking any actions. You can also cease concentration Instantly.
If you cast a spell with concentration, you must hold the staff in order to maintain your concentration. Being disarmed of a staff you are using to concentrate ends the effect. While you are concentrating on a spell, you cannot use that staff to cast other spells. However, you can use another staff to cast spells, or concentrate on another.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Contingent
item.description:
The effect can be cast ahead of time with a specific trigger for when it activates. A creature can only have a single contingent effect active on them at once.
The effect manifests as a clearly visible wisp of energy that floats around the creature. The DC to identify the effect increases by 5, but the fact that there is a contingent effect is clear.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Curse
item.description: Curse effects inflict permanent debilitating conditions on creatures. Curses cannot be dispelled, but they all have some way to get rid of them. This usually requires some convoluted action most people wouldn't do unless prompted. Can be identified using the "identify curse or affliction" feature in the Medicine skill.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Darkness
item.description: Effect either creates darkness, or has special interactions when in it.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dismissible
item.description:
Dismissible (D) effects can be ended prematurely by the caster as a Standard Action.
Note that voluntary effects (such as buffs) can be dismissed Instantly without this tag.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Earth
item.description:
Spell manipulates earth to produce its effect.
This is a non-Damage elemental tag.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Elusive
item.description: Elusive: This action doesn't provoke an AoO.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Emotion
item.description: An Emotion effect is a Mind-Affecting effect that relies on manipulating the target's emotions.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fear
item.description: Usually inflicts Shaken or Frightened. All fear effects are also Mind-Affecting.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Figment
item.description:
Figments create creatures, objects, and terrain that don’t truly exist. As long as the creature does not directly interact with a figment, it believes it to be real. If a creature figures out that it's fake and tells its allies, or demonstrates by moving through it, they no longer believe it to be real. Directly interacting requires doing things like walking into a wall or attacking a creature, upon which the creature rolls a Will save. A failure indicates the creature will try to run around an obstacle or that they missed a creature.
If used to satisfy the conditions of a surrender (such as making a spooky monster), the creatures affected get a will save to negate it. They have +6 on this save if they saw you cast the spell.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Glamer
item.description: A Glamer changes a subject’s sensory qualities, making it look, feel, taste, smell, or sound like something else, or nothing at all.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Language-Dependent
item.description: Language-Dependent effects require the target to understand your spoken words, or requires some form of clear communication that mimics language (like Telepathy).
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Martial
item.description:
Martial effects allow the user to deliver the effect using the ACC and Damage and On-Hit Effects of a wielded Weapon, even if it mentions using another form of attack.
Martial techniques and Special Attacks by default ALWAYS have the martial tag. It is not listed to save time/space.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Mind-Affecting
item.description: Mind-Affecting effects are a more general group that include things like Fear effects, Charms, and more. Creatures that are Mindless cannot be affected by mind-affecting effects.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Multi-Strike
item.description: This effect, when used with an Action-Attack, is improved by attacking multiple times. It may apply its effect to every attack on your turn.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Pattern
item.description: Like a Figment, a Pattern creates an image that others can see, but a pattern also affects the minds of those who see it or are caught in it. Common effects include Fascination or Blurred Vision. Pattern effects are also Mind-Affecting.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Persistent
item.description: Persistent Effects have an initial effect and an effect that persists over time. This type of effect cannot deal its persistent effect on the same round as its initial effect. Persistent effects end preemptively if the user is Defeated.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Polymorph
item.description:
Polymorph effects transform creatures into other creatures. Many of the features granted from polymorph effects are based off the Shapeshifter's class features. You retain the ability to speak while polymorphed. When transforming using a polymorph effect, it can fall under one of the following to determine the nature of your transformation (some can be multiple).
Chimeric Polymorph - Your form stays roughly the same, but acquires some features of the new creature that you're transforming into, such as claws, fur, a long tongue etc. When you chimeric polymorph, you do not lose access to any of your gear.
True Polymorph - Your form completely changes to the form mentioned in the ability. You completely lose access to all of your equipment. There are only a handful of features recognizable from your previous self, such as eye color.
Baleful Polymorph - This form of polymorph is inflicted upon you rather than willingly used. It functions very similarly to true polymorph, but provides fewer tangible benefits and often include debilitating Status. You lose access to your equipment and cannot speak.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Scrying
item.description:
Scrying effects create a specific type of magic sensor, often from remote locations, usually for the purpose of spying on people. The sensor allows you to see and hear anything with any of your senses, so long as it is in the specified range the effect mentions.
Scrying sensors are clearly visible to the naked eye. They usually take the form of an eye. Sensors that can move can use the caster's stealth bonus to hide as they move.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Sigil
item.description: The effect puts magical text on a surface with some kind of delayed effect, usually triggering when a creature walks within a certain radius of the sigil. A sigil must be clearly visible in order to function. If it is obscured, then it is deactivated until it is unobscured. Most sigils have the ability to apply a passphrase that, when spoken aloud, allows a user to move through the area without triggering the sigil.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Tag
item.description:
Tags are descriptors that let you apply general rules to similar effects. Tags are not just limited to spells, but spells do commonly use tags. Certain tags may only effect specific parts of an ability. Use discretion when needed.
See:

Abnegation
Conjuration
Divination

item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Teleportation
item.description: Teleportation effects allow the user, and sometimes their allies, to instantly travel between two locations. Teleportation tends to be very limited in scope, bringing you to very specific predetermined places or being wildly off-course if not. If unspecified, you must have line of sight to the location you are teleporting to.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Water
item.description:
Effect manipulates water to produce its effect.
This is a non-Damage elemental tag.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Rolling Dice and Statistics
item.description:
This game relies on a special roll, detailed below. It will be referred to as dX in the content.
Action resolution is done by using random chance to represent a range of success in an attempt to reach a target number, combined with a bonus based on your character's build, such as from their ability scores, skills, class features, active buffs, and feats.
Content is currently being made with a roll equivalent to counting successes on a d15 die, exploding on any number above 1, success being any roll (including the first). This can be written into rolling simulator websites such as Roll20 to speed things up.
The benefit of this method is that anyone can roll any number, unlike other systems where a large enough target number will make the roll impossible.
The Short Version: Every point added for or against these rolls is about a 7% difference in power. This means Attack Rolls, Skill checks, Saving Throws, DCs, Avoid, all of it. A 6 point difference is roughly a 50% boost in odds. A 10 point difference is about double. As an example, if you gain 10 Accuracy or 10 Stealth, your odds of success are about twice as high. This is the case regardless of the opponent's statistics.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Rolling Dice and Statistics.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Armor
item.description:
Armors of varying weights have STR requirements, granting more AC at higher values. You lose 10 Speed and Jump for every point of STR you lack (minimum 5). Armor takes the Armor Equipment Slot.
The following are the three most simple and common forms of armor. Light armor consists of hard leathers and gambesons, medium armor includes chain and scales with breastplates, and heavy armor covers every part of the body with a combination of plate, chain, and gambesons.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Shield
item.description:
Shields are a subtype Weapon Group. Not all shields can be used as weapons, however.
Shields are primarily used to gain defensive abilities to use as Actions, and most also passively increase your defenses (Mainly AC). Many shields have minimum STR requirements just like Armor, which penalize you in the same manner.
Unless otherwise stated, shields are 1-handed.
The following are the basic shields.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Background
item.description:
Background helps to determine what your character was doing before they got sucked up into an adventure. Other than acquiring the skills necessary to go out into the dangerous world, of course.
Backgrounds give starting bonuses or equipment.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Family Man
item.description:
You are the primary owner of a house somewhere in the world, usually at least on the tangent of civilization. You lived with either your immediate family, like parents and siblings, or you made a family of your own with a spouse and children.
You own a meager house in a specific place, and a handful of family members to come home to after an adventure. Your house is always considered a suitable place to rest in order to cure general afflictions.
See Backgrounds
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Noble
item.description:
You come from an upper ring of society. Your name might not carry the same weight everywhere you go, but your gold pouch certainly does.
You get a bonus 1,000 starting gold that you can spend as you wish. Your family also gives you an allowance every month of 500g. For campaigns with a faster or slower pace, such as if there are frequent time skips, consider changing how often the allowance comes in.
If you are far from home, it can take up to a week for your allowance to arrive. They can only ever be picked up from settlements.
See Backgrounds
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Wanderer
item.description:
You go wherever the road takes you. You might have had a home once, but for one reason or another you had to or wanted to leave.
You start play with a standard rock. More information can be found in the bestiary. Very basically, rocks are autonomous mass transportation and shipping vehicles. Most significant places in civilization will have service stations and parking available.
See Backgrounds
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Common Prices
item.description:
LV 1 Characters start off with 3000g to spend. Higher level characters should get more gold, determined by the DM and as appropriate for the sort of campaign being run.
The following are prices of basic equipment. Recall that basic equipment is the lowest quality available. This is budget equipment suitable for militias, thugs, and beginner adventurers.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Economics
item.description:
Daily income, typically through the use of a skill, like profession, perform or alchemy.
All income is based around a formula which calculates a yearly salary (y) based on your skill bonus (x).
y=10000+x^2 * 250
Salary assumes you work for 5 days a week, 50 weeks a year. Divide this value by 250 to figure our your daily income. The chart below does this formula for you for most expected values. Anything lower than a +0 bonus to the task at hand makes a 5k salary, or 20g daily.
This formula assumes a prosperous nation with a lot of economic opportunity and a population with many thousands of people per city. In poorer and less populous regions, consider using the following multiplier for all goods and services.
Developing - Multiply all values by .75
Poor - Multiply all values by .5
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Mana Donation
item.description:
By going to specialized facilities, or by going to churches with gilded altars, an untrained creature can donate Mana via Mana Burn. A creature can safely donate up to one less than their maximum. There are usually safeguards against donating your max mana, but less savory individuals don't mind. Spending your max mana gives you the Tier 3 Affliction Mana Starvation. This means that most common people are only able to donate 1 Mana each day. Children typically do not possess enough mana to safely donate.
Specialized facilities and gilded altars are incredibly expensive, typically costing hundreds of thousands of gold to craft. This makes it so facilities for mana donation tend to be rather sparse, only located in sizable settlements with magical and religious influence.
When mana is extracted, it is turned into a Mana Crystal. Mana Crystals are versatile and can change between states of matter, becoming either liquid or solid for ease of storage. Each point of mana can earn 4g in a mana extraction facility. In a church, it earns 5 GBP and food/lodging for the day.

Most religious services happen in the evening after work, so that way people may spend their mana as they wish during the day, and donate it at night if they wish. With large generous populations this can mean that you can amass large quantities of mana rather quickly. Because most people can only donate 1 mana, you can almost 1:1 translate a population of donors to daily mana generation. Not everybody who donates has commoner tier mana, but at the same time, not everybody can always donate! So the 1:1 ratio is generally the go-to method of determining mana generation over time.
Again, not all places have the correct facilities, so this is often available in villages.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Populations
item.description:
Settlements receive classifications based on population. More populous settlements tend to condense more wealth, have more facilities and are more cosmopolitan. Expensive or luxurious services can be expected in larger settlements, but are unheard of in smaller ones.
Hamlet - <1,000 people
Village - 1,000+ people
City - 10,000+ people
Metropolis - 100k+ people
Some general assumptions about a given population:

About 10% of the population is assumed to be over level 0, with a skew towards early levels.
Most regions have a dominant religion, with at around half the population favoring them. Metropolises tend to have more variety, while hamlets tend to be entirely dominated by a single religion.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: The Cost of Living
item.description:
Staying alive requires resources and food. The easiest way to obtain and represent these is to spend money. Only accounting for minimum food and necessities, the basic cost to remaining alive is 10g per day.
In a town, where sleeping on the streets isn't advised, the cost increases to 30g.
The savings from living in the wilderness are made up by the time spent setting up camps and creating one's own resources, as per Live off Land. Characters that do not spend this money must spend additional time collecting enough food to survive. Players should lose this much gold every day to represent the use of supplies. If they are on a particularly long journey where they will not encounter others to sell them supplies, they must spend this money ahead of time to avoid running out of supplies.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: The Value of Gold
item.description:
Estimating the true value of a single unit of currency is difficult to do when considering the possibilities of every setting. However, in order to establish some reference for pricing adventuring gear and items, we have to settle on one - so, for the purposes of the default pricing and earnings, we're going forward with the assumption that the differences between the peasants, tradesmen, and aristocrats is large, but not in such a way that compromises the ability of the peasantry to afford basic items.
As a fantasy setting with swords and monsters, there are comparisons to be made to the value of labor in the medieval era. However, in order to avoid mixing the complexities of medieval economics with magic and superheroes to an audience that may not have studied such, the gap between the peasants and aristocrats is reduced, and social mobility is substantially increased.
If a more extreme economy is desired, adjust the earnings from Economics and The Cost of Living.
Average laborers like farmers can be expected to make ~10-20k gold every year, with the amount increasing with more sophisticated trades such as smiths or merchants.
Gold pieces are small coins and are virtually weightless due to the minting process performed by the financial wizards. Another benefit of this minting is that it causes gold pieces to naturally stack into specific values (5, 10, 20, 100, 1000). Someone can easily hold 100g in their pockets, or 1000g in a dedicated pouch. Anything more and they are bursting at the seams and would be better off with a bank, or to switch to alternative methods of payment.
Carrying around a bag of 100,000g would be like the real-world equivalent of carrying around a several briefcases full of paper currency. While this may happen for large transactions or when hauling away a dragon's horde, it's usually difficult to avoid drawing attention if you were to do it on the regular.
When imagining gold costs, use the following:
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Mundane Item
item.description: Mundane Items can usually be bought in many locations around the world with the correct vendor in town. Many have real life analogues.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Property
item.description:
Mundane Item.
Property is synonymous with land, and everything on it. Property can include facilities, homes, or resources of interest. The price of property changes based on a few factors, such as size, buildings, appearance, location, and the overall state its in, to name a few.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Tools
item.description:
80g Mundane Item
Tools typically come in sets catered to a specific task, such as fishing or medicine. Some tasks require the use of tools, others only give a penalty if you don't have tools.
Tools also come in a masterwork variety, giving the user a +4 bonus on the skill in question. The price is increased to 800g.
Some tasks do not have associated tools, and therefore are not suitable for acquiring masterwork variants to them. Skills like medicine, alchemy and profession use tools. Skills like stealth, perception and persuasion do not. Some types of tools might be able to aid you with novel types of tasks, such as using a spyglass to roll perception long distances, but should not give any types of persistent flat bonuses.
Most tool kits weigh 10 lbs. Some tasks, such as smithing, require even more advanced tools you can't carry around, such as a forge.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Torch
item.description:
10g Mundane Item
Torches are sticks wrapped with some type of cloth, chemical or vegetable matter that is flammable. Torches give off bright light in a 20 ft radius around them, and dim light 20 ft past that.
They can stay lit for up to 2 hours. Lighting and dimming a torch repeatedly can significantly decrease the amount of time they stay lit.
If a torch ends up getting wet, it becomes unusable.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Ammunition
item.description:
Ammunition is a subtype Weapon Group. All Ammunition is either also part of another Weapon Group, or does not function as a weapon on its own.
These represent arrows, bolts, rocks, bullets, darts, or any other weapon that is either part of another weapon's use, or that is meant to be launched by itself in quick succession.
Ammunition can be drawn as an Instant Action.
Ammunition and its price and weight represent an unlimited source. You cannot easily "share" or otherwise split Ammunition between allies. You either have the ammunition or you don't - Exceptions can be made in the heat of combat, such as firing back an arrow that just hit a tree next to you.
item.guid: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Subtypes/Ammunition.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Natural Weapon
item.description:
Natural Weapons are a subtype Weapon Group. All Natural Weapons are also part of another Weapon Group.
These weapons are part of a creature's being. Examples include claws, fists, tails, horns, stingers, and tentacles.
Most natural weapons are not universal, meaning they are different for each creature that has them and will be noted as such in their stat block. However, they do follow common trends.
item.guid: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Subtypes/Natural Weapon.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Staff
item.description: A staff is a subtype Weapon Group. This is also a label used for anything that can complete the Staff (S) component of spells.
item.guid: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Subtypes/Staff.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Axe
item.description:
Axes are a group of Weapons that can be 1-handed or 2-handed.
These weapons are made to cut or pierce using chopping motions.
The following are the Basic Weapons in the Axe group.
item.guid: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Axe.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Blade
item.description:
Blades are a group of Weapons that can be 1-handed or 2-handed.
These weapons are meant for slicing and stabbing, relying on the blade to do the cutting with a mere touch rather than chopping or committed thrusts.
The following are the Basic Weapons in the Blade group.
item.guid: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Blade.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Bludgeon
item.description:
Bludgeons are a group of Weapons that can be 1-handed or 2-handed.
These weapons are meant to beat the snot out of enemies in the most primitive way possible.
The following are the Basic Weapons in the Bludgeon group.
item.guid: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Bludgeon.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Bow
item.description:
Bows are a group of Weapons that are 2-handed.
These are curved weapons held at the ends by taut or resistant elastic strings used for firing Ammunition with a drawing motion.
The following are the Basic Weapons in the Bow group.
item.guid: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Bow.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dagger
item.description:
Daggers are a group of Weapons that are 1-handed.
These are short, sharp weapons for getting close to enemies and striking weak spots or overwhelming them with angles of attack.
The following are the Basic Weapons in the Dagger group.
item.guid: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Dagger.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Thrust
item.description:
Thrust weapons are a group of Weapons that can be 1-handed or 2-handed.
These are blades and spears meant for dedicated thrusts to put enormous pressure at a single point. Often used to outrange and lunge at opponents.
The following are the Basic Weapons in the Thrust group.
item.guid: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Thrust.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Basic Weapon
item.description: Basic Weapons are the default Weapons of a Weapon Group. They represent the effectiveness of common or makeshift weaponry. They have no Upgrade Slots, and come with the fewest amount of Weapon Qualities.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Exotic Weapon
item.description: Exotic Weapons do not neatly fit into any Weapon Groups, and will list how they differ. They often break the norms of conventional weaponry.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Weapon
item.description:
Weapons are the most basic method of increasing one's offensive power. Just having a weapon and attacking an enemy is often enough to make you a substantial threat, regardless of your expertise or abilities.
Weapons fall into Weapon Groups for the purpose of identifying what Special Attacks, Abilities, and Techniques they're compatible with. The categories describe how they are used to attack, rather than how they look. If a weapon has more than one main category, then that means its category changes based on the way it is used, such as throwing a dagger instead of swinging it.
There are ten main categories:

And 4 subtypes:

Exotic Weapons do not neatly fit into these categories, and will list how they differ.
Weapons come with damage values, attack speed values, and damage types as their core stats, in addition to the categories listed above.
All standard weapons deal a physical Damage type. If a weapon has more than one damage type, you can decide which to use before you make a given attack with it.
Damage values and Attack Speed correlate such that the damage tends to be very similar without any additional abilities or STR. The typical offense-oriented damage values and AS are as follows:

Weapons with ranged capabilities (thrown or otherwise) will also have a listed range. Ranges come in an X/Y format, with the X range being the accurate range, and the Y taking a -4 penalty, referred to as the Range.

Some weapons come with Techniques and Special Attacks. These temporarily grant you a technique as long as you wield them. As per the Mana rules, you cannot sacrifice your own Mana to get another use of a Limited Technique unless otherwise stated.
Special Attacks specifically are also tied to the weapon - If you use the Special Attack, you cannot pass the weapon off to another creature to use it again, and the weapon has its own Recharge timer.
Many weapons come with Weapon Qualities. These describe what a weapon does beyond its classification, Damage, and AS.
Unless otherwise stated, Weapons weights default to the following:
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Weapon Group
item.description:
A Weapon Group is a categorization of Weapons that describes the way it is used in combat, and is used to identify what Special Attacks, Abilities, and Techniques they're compatible with. The categories describe how they are used to attack, rather than how they look. If a weapon has more than one main category, then that means its category changes based on the way it is used, such as throwing a dagger instead of swinging it.
There are 10 main groups: Axe, Blade, Bludgeon, Bow, Close, Dagger, Polearm, Thrown/Caster, Thrust, and Trigger,
and 4 sub-groups: Ammunition, Natural, Shield, and Staff.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Equipment Slot
item.description: There is a limit to how much wearable equipment you can use at once. This is represented by Equipment Slots, each of which can hold one piece of equipment of that type. By default, humanoid characters start off with the following Equipment Slots:
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Antagonize
item.description:
Combat Feat
Use Intimidation or Deception to Demoralize a creature. Instead of being Shaken, they are Taunted for one round.
You can extend the duration by using your Swift Action on consecutive turns.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Back to the Wall
item.description:
Combat Feat
You cannot be flanked as long as you are adjacent to a wall.
You are considered flanking a creature that is adjacent to a wall.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Blind Fight
item.description:
Combat Feat
You are not Surprised❗ while Blinded. You ignore Concealment AC bonuses.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Bodyguard
item.description:
Combat Feat
When an ally is moved out of your natural reach (via its own volition or not), you can move as an Instant Action so that it is again in your natural reach.
Any movement you take using this feat counts against your movement for this round. If you cannot reach your ally, you can move as close as you can get. You can position yourself in the most advantageous way around your ally, assuming you have the movement.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Bonded Weapons
item.description:
Combat Feat
Gain the ability to perform a 10 minute ritual that allows you to bond with 2 specific weapons.
You cannot be Disarmed of these weapons.
When you throw these weapons, they automatically Teleport to your hand after the attack is resolved, if desired.
If these weapons somehow manage to leave your possession otherwise, you can spend a swift action to have them Teleport to your hand.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Clustered Blows
item.description:
Combat Feat
When you attack the same creature multiple times on your turn, apply DR only once.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Combat Reflexes
item.description:
Combat Feat
You can draw a weapon as part of an AoO if you have a free hand.
Gain two additional AoOs. Opponents can tell you continue to threaten past the first AoO.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Elemental Adept
item.description:
Combat Feat
Choose an element from the magical Damage types.
You ignore Resistance against this element. Immunity becomes Resistance.
Whenever you wield this element, there is something visually distinct about it versus the norm, such as your flames turning black.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Endurance
item.description:
Combat Feat
Requirement: +1 STR
The first time you would be Defeated or outright killed in a day, you are instead not Defeated. If it was a result of taking damage, your HP is set to 1.
Whenever you are Defeated, you can make a single attack immediately before you are Defeated.
You automatically pass the STR Roll when Recovering from Defeat.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fan Club
item.description:
Combat Feat
Requirement: +1 CHA, LV 3
You use your influence and charm to gain a group of people that appreciate you. They are often willing to perform minor tasks for you, stick their neck out for you, but not risk their life for you. They are located in one specific place at first, but they may branch as you gain more levels and influence.
The size of your fan club is CHA((LV)^2).
One member of your fan club is your biggest fan. Your biggest fan is always a Minion. Other than that, there are no restrictions for what your biggest fan can be. When you gain this feat, you decide their class, race, stats etc. They count as a companion if they travel with you.
Your biggest fan doesn't necessarily need to be a playable race, but those that aren't should be acquired through story related encounters rather than chosen.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fearsome Finisher
item.description:
Combat Feat
Requirement: Intimidation Proficiency
Whenever you Defeat a creature, you can use Demoralize as an Instant Action, and you get +4 Intimidation for the rest of the combat.
When using Demoralize in this way, you Frighten the target for one round in addition to the normal effects.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fleet Footwork
item.description:
Combat Feat
Requirement: +1 DEX
Increase your base speed by 5ft.
Your movement is Elusive against any target you have hit with a melee Attack this turn.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Ghost Buster
item.description:
Combat Feat
Requirement: Religion Proficiency
You treat Incorporeal creatures as though they were corporeal.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Longshot
item.description:
Combat Feat
At the start of your turn, you can reduce your speed to 0 to remove the penalty from making a Ranged Attack with the second Range increment for this round.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Maneuver Adept
item.description:
Combat Feat
You get +4 ACC with Combat Maneuvers, and they can be used as a regular Attack instead of an Action-Attack. This means you can replace an AoO or other simple attack with a Combat Maneuver.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Quickstep
item.description:
Combat Feat
Requirements: +2 DEX
You can reduce your speeds to 10 to make your movement elusive.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Spellbreaker
item.description:
Combat Feat
Requirement: Arcana Proficiency
When striking a creature that is currently holding Concentration on a spell with a melee Attack, they must make a Fortitude save or stop concentrating.
A Ranged Attack can be used as well, but the target gets a +4 bonus to their save.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Escape Route
item.description:
Teamwork Feat
Movement out of threatened squares also threatened by your allies is elusive.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Move As One
item.description:
Teamwork Feat
During an ally's turn, if they move, you can spend an Immediate Action to use your movement to move along with them. You must either end this movement within their natural reach, or threatening the same enemy as them.
You subtract this movement from your movement next turn.
Turn based games make movement awkward, but the idea is you are moving together, so other positional effects, such as Escape Route or Shield Brothers, can treat moving allies as within reach for the duration of the movement in circumstances where allies converge on a location or start in positions that are close to each other.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Pack Tactics
item.description:
Teamwork Feat
Flanking only requires threatening the same enemy, regardless of position.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Shield Brothers
item.description:
Teamwork Feat
Gain +2 AC when you are within the natural reach of an ally that wields a shield. The shield must have an AC bonus.
You can use any shield benefit on an ally instead of yourself, as long as they remain within your reach.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Tandem Charge
item.description:
Teamwork Feat
Requirement - Move As One
During an ally's turn, if they make a Charge Attack, you can spend an Immediate Action to charge along with them and make a simple attack. You must charge attack the same creature they do.
Your Speed is zero on your next turn.
Turn based games make movement awkward, but the idea is you are moving together, so other positional effects, such as Escape Route or Shield Brothers, can treat moving allies as within reach for the duration of the movement in circumstances where allies converge on a location or start in positions that are close to each other.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Feat
item.description:
Feats are class features in progression that are gained every odd level. They allow your character to get bonuses to specific actions, abilities from other classes, and occasionally get general stat increases.
Some feats have prerequisites, such as stat requirements, Skill Proficiency, or other feats. You must meet all of the requirements of a feat to take it.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Stat Feat
item.description:
A Stat Feat grants numerical bonuses, such as to Skills or ACC, usually unconditionally, and not much else.
These are for rounding out weaknesses and giving an indecisive PC or DM an easy pick-me.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Teamwork Feat
item.description: A Teamwork Feat is a Feat that provides a benefit only if used with other creatures that have the same feat.
